Element Kuala Lumpur Hotel.address: Ilham Tower, no.8 Jalan Binjai, Kuala Lumpur 50450 Malaysia

1.review_text: I'm expat working here in KL. I'm very happy staying here. Spacious room with modern style is my like. Equiped with various food choices. Breakfast is very satify too. Banana pancake by Chief Men is a must!!

2.review_text: Really best hotel,best lounge, best fool and best staffs really nice place, i like the swimming pool views hopefully one day i can come back there again, i should back again i miss you KL best regard frm me😍

3.review_text: Stayed here for one night cause of work during MCO 2.0, good service, especially from Feroz (GSA), was very helpful and also explained everything very clearly, rooms were very decently priced and very well maintained and clean, also had a nice view of the city, will be coming back again after this lockdown is over

4.review_text: Stayed here with my husband during the CMCO. As a platinum member, the hotel had very kindly upgraded us to their one bedroom suite. The suite was extremely huge with a very well equipped kitchen (pots, pans, plates etc). You could totally have a cooking party in this room. The only unfortunate thing about this room was the view. Our windows were blocked by the building facade and hence despite being on a very high floor, our view was severely limited. Gym was tiny but well equipped. Not forgetting the amazing view from the gym. Breakfast selection was slightly limited and guests had to walk around to get the food which was not great in hindsight in view of the current pandemic.  Overall, a fairly decent stay. Will I return? Maybe when the pool reopens.

5.review_text: I had a room booked with breakfast and in room decor  It was a great stay and the room decoration is the best  My wife had really really great time  But the anniversary cake was a bit stale  If you looking a room for couple, this hotel offers a great view and great breakfast  Recommended for 2021 stay :)

6.review_text: Staff was courteous and polite, all the way from the bellboy at the ground floor, to the receptionist at 40th floor, to the butler service, to the friendliest chef ❤️  The studio skyline room was comfortably sized, would prefer a one bedroom suite due to the bathtub but the suite with skyline view was fully booked. Anyhow, room was sparkling clean, well equipped with equipments & utensils, love the microwave especially. Love how well lit the room is and how thoughtful the hotel staff is to place a junior bed for my boy, he was thrilled to see his the little space set up for him ❤️   Buffet at Trace was generally nice, dining with a view, love the ambience. Food variety could be improved, but not a big problem because the food quality was good.   Money to value wise was only ok…

7.review_text: Check in was fast at 40th floor. But there's only 1 staff working at front desk ( Peggy from Sarawak/Sabah) lucky she is very professional handling it wit/ my check-in issue.  Cafe next to reception breakfast is okay...  Parking fees is $15.00 for hotel guests.

8.review_text: Had an amazing staycation at Elements Kuala Lumpur. Everything was perfect from check in to check out. Amazing and attentive staff. They even upgraded our 2 bedroom suite to skyline view.  Definitely will be back here again. Already got my reservation for next week. See you guys soon

9.review_text: Manage to book Studio Skyline view for 1 night at rates benefiting from my Marriot Bonvoy membership. We were given room at level 42. Actually the stay is for the celebration of my grandmum's 84th. Its located at the Iconic Menara Ilham and being one of the most tallest hotel in KL (after Four Seasons). The interior design of this hotel is not the typical hotel - look more like corporate setting due to the function of Ilham Tower I guess.  Here's some pointers of our experience during our short staycation.  Pros: (1) Location - it is considered as central within the KLCC district. What you can ask more? (2)  Amenities - The studio room is fully equipped with all necessities. There are plates, cutlery, dishwashing liquid, microwave, minibar, safe deposit, iron with board, decent…

10.review_text: One year ago my visit wasn’t exactly perfect. Would have given them lower.  One year ago today, they have improved tremendously. Bonvoy status absolutely recognised, buffet breakfast had lesser choices but more targeted and food tasted WAY better. A year ago food was horrible.... I would see it has a significant improve since my last visit.  In terms of quality and standards it beats Four Points. It is slightly more expensive but I would pay to stay here - due to the overall experience. The finishing of the building is also much better which means better soundproof.   One setback is their door doesn’t shut completely when you leave so you need to PULL it. Unlike other hotels the weight of the door and the moment you let it go it closes by itself. Got to be careful with that. …

11.review_text: Maybe it’s cause if COVID 19 pandemic, driving hotel prices to lowest possible, but I thought that the prices for one night with a great view of the twin towers was really worth spending.  Not to mention that the bed was up to the Sheraton old standards - firm and yet incredibly soft to sink in with pleasure.  There was a little misunderstanding at check in when I was told they have room services, but I found out in the morning wasn’t available for breakfast, which I was craving for.  Anyway, the breakfast buffet was work the money.

12.review_text: Thanks The Element Team who arrange simple deco for our short and sweet anniversarication at your hotel especially Miki & team. Thanks for upgrade our room to skyline king room with the view of KLCC twin tower. if you looking highest room in the sky, you may choose Element to experience a stay here. Located just few blocks with LRT ampang park and walking distance to KLCC, Ampang Park & Intermark. Highest hotel lobby as well located at Level 41 we experience stay in hotel around KL. Thanks The Element & wish you all the very best in this trying times for all of us.

13.review_text: went here to have a staycation and work from hotel mode for 2 nights. very spacious room with fantastic view at level 53. love the amenities and facilities. suitable for working with comfortable desk and chair. and of coz, great KL skyline. the hotel also provided a pantry and kitchenette. we can have a comfortable dining in room. the best part is the swimming pool. they use salt water pool and it is very warm. had my own session every time i went for a swim.

14.review_text: The 2 bedroom Apartment is spacious and has a nice view. The foods at Trace are great and love the free beverages. My kids enjoyed their stay there. Staff are helpful and friendly too. Theres also a convenient store located at the ground floor.

15.review_text: Element is not your typical hotel, for one it's supposed to be the longer stays category, but that didn't stop us from staying for one night here for staycation.  Check in was hassle-free and right away was given room on level 51, among the top floors of this property. And the view from the room was nothing short of amazing.  I ordered Penang Fried Koay Teow which was of good price and delicious.  One of the highlights of this property is the indoor re required to book their slots first, which was a good thing. We ended up having the whole pool for ourselves later on.

16.review_text: Great Hotel on the 40th. - 47th. Floor of Ilham Tower, offering amazing 360 degree views of the City. We were here for my wife's Birthday. They even decorated the bed and sent her a Chocolate Cake. Staff was awesome. Trace Restaurant food and service was superb.

17.review_text: To mark a special occasion, and as the Movement Control Order (Malaysia’s version of a partial lockdown) trundles on, we decided to go on a Staycation in one of our home city’s hotels.  This time, we chose the Element by Westin, which is located in the KLCC area of Kuala Lumpur. If you are a fan of architecture, well the Element is actually the hotel component in a mixed used skyscraper called the Menara Ilham, a building designed by the famed British architect Sir Norman Foster of Foster + Partners.  The building itself is listed as being 58-storeys and 274m in height, and at the time of writing, is listed as the 7th most tallest building in Malaysia and the 2nd tallest hotel (after the Four Seasons). The Element takes up the upper floors of the building, from Level 39 to Level…

18.review_text: Very wonderful stay at Element Hotel.  Got very good service from restaurant manager Mr ULAN and Mosses.  The environment is enjoyable and really feel refresh.   Family really enjoyed stay here.  Will visit again.   Thanks.

19.review_text: Location 10/10. Just beside Ampang Park LRT The rooms is clean and New I have a wonderful stay with my family. My little princess enjoyed it alot especially on the way they have decorated the hotel. Good vibes at night (ground level)

20.review_text: My favourite hotel for quiet weekend staycation and I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite this time around. Check in on 40th Floor and rooms are on higher floors. Spectacular views of the surroundings. I especially love the comfy bed. Room is fully equipped with, fridge, microwave, tableware & cutlery, pantry sink and clean water from tap. Love it!

21.review_text: From Staff Cleanliness Room Service Bedding Pool area  Everything is 10 out of 10. Well done element kl team..  Didnt has a chance to have our breakfast or dinner there.so im sorry no comment from me about their dining service. Keep up the good work!!! definitely will come back this 29th august..wait me!  Staying at 42th floor. Date:15th august 2020.

22.review_text: Stayed 1 night in the Studio Skyline room. All rooms are above 40th floor with 40th floor being the reception area. My room was on the 44th floor and could see the KL Tower (Menara Kuala Lumpur)  and partial Petronas Twin Towers. The hotel is a 3-min walk to Ampang Park LRT Station, which is just a stop away from KLCC.  The room is clean, spacious and bright with the floor-to-ceiling windows! The washroom spots an elegant style - marble flooring and walls with a standing shower (be careful that floor might be slippery when wet!). Overall, the hotel adopts a very contemporary design. The corridor and lift lobby felt like an art gallery!  I like their focus in being green and such initiatives are ubiquitous in the hotel (eg. skip the straws, bike lending system, etc). The room has…

23.review_text: one thing that this hotel really got it right is having ALL its staffs providing friendly service to guests...from the concierge to the reception and to the day manager all were polite and friendly to us. And best of all my request for a room with KLCC view and for early check in was complied without problem EXCELLENT! no complaint at all about the modern design and room facilities all are up to expectation of this class of hotel. My only wish is they can provide complimentary parking instead of charging daily rate. I will definitely return to this wonderful hotel and keep up the good and friendly service as that is the winning factor for any hotel in my opinion.

24.review_text: Check inn service: Top. Spacious and tidy rooms and extra needed toilet supplies included. Breakfast is good. I would like to personally thank the two reliable, loyal & hospitality and casual talented employees Nadia & Jeffrey. The rememberly stay over at the element by westin . Maybe i will be come back.

25.review_text: Everything in KL is high, so don’t be surprised to find reception on floor 40. Had a great room with a good view. Spacious clean bathroom. Breakfast has a wide choice of western and Asian food. Lovely fruit and a very smiley egg man!  Only disappointment was to find the swimming pool closed.

26.review_text: They have a really nice indoor pool but kept having maintenance problem. Hopefully this time the pool closure(out of service) is meant for a serious improvement work to eliminate all issues. I especially appreciate getting courtesy email from Peggy/At Your Service pertaining pool closure, prior to my stay. So I was already prepared for this. Peggy also assisted me with my stay preference and arrangement. Front Desk efficient as always. Thanks to Lennie(sorry if wrongly spelt) and Haiqal. Looking forward to completion of the pool construction.

27.review_text: The closest to home feeling in the heart of Kuala Lumpur Metropolitan. Spectacular view with a free flow hot beverages & the whole entire hotel is so  artistic. Eco friendly hotel where they serve filtered tap water. So easy to drink without asking for bottle water. You can either dine in with the touch of western infuse with local taste or you can have the comfort of cooking your own food in the hotel room.   Just a class on its own!!

28.review_text: Stayed here for a few days. A modern hotel that is well decorated and comfy. Room was on the 52 floor with lovely views over the city towards Petronas tower.Good breakfast with a wide selection of food.  Good location 3 minutes walk to the rapid transit.

29.review_text: Incredible designed hotel with exquisite art throughout the hotel with perhaps the most stellar views of Kuala Lumpur. We arrived to the hotel to be greeted by Daniel the bellman/porter who was incredibly welcoming & professional a great way to be welcomed to a hotel. The pool was out of device we were told at check in, so we’re upgraded in room categories. The room was very large, excellent bed and washroom facilities. The breakfast needs to be improved upon, basic , nothing was outstanding , mediocre at best. ..infact some food was cold, we were disappointed. When we checked out Daniel came to get our luggage with a smile and great suggestions of what to see in the city and held our bags as we went to the Art Gallery on the 5th floor, he is what makes service 5 star and needs…

30.review_text: Hotel set in a Sky scrapper, rooms all set on floors from 40 to 53, ours was on level 49. Good breakfast very poor service for Dinner though. Staff very attentive for Breakfast but did not seem interested in Hotel client at all more interested in public off the street. You did though receive a 30% discount off your food if staying at hotel. Down side of the stay Swimming Pool out of service, you needed it due to the temperature in KL.

31.review_text: From Ampang Park LRT station, it is about 2 minutes walk to the hotel.  It is located at Menara Ilham, a tall black glass panel tower block, a stone throw from Intercontinental Hotel. It took us about 10 minutes walk to KLCC.  Reception counter is located at the 40th floor.  Check-in is simple and fast.  Needed to pay a deposit of RM500 upfront.  Balance refunded upon check-out.  Stayed at Double Studio room RM349.80 (all taxes) with breakfast for 2.  It was at 42nd floor with a panoramic view of KL skylines.  Room is clean and big.  Perhaps, formerly it was a condo apartment, the facilities include microwave oven, washing basin with 2 taps – washing and drinking, iron, safe deposit box and other normal hotel amenities.  Wifi speed was fast.  It was a comfortable stay.  Bathroom…

32.review_text: Liked  · The Staff.... Sylvia at the Front Desk was great, she helped me a lot the first night that I arrived, and Ira... she was phenomenal. Ira’s customer service skills are superb, Element is blessed to have her as an employee. The breakfast is worth waking up for, the layout, design, and views from the Suites on the higher floors are perfect. The Starbucks within a short walking distance is a great added perk. Being able to wash / dry your own clothes at the Hotel is GREAT. The greatest blessing was that the Hotel allowed me to leave some of my luggage there in storage for a week while I traveled around SE Asia and then retrieve it when I checked back into the hotel upon my return to KL!  Disliked - The lifts are annoying, slow and loud at times, hopefully this has been…

33.review_text: Amazing hotel located right in the klcc area and close to all the main tourist attractions and places of interest. The hotel is very clean, appealing and eco friendly. The rooms are very spacious and there’s enough breathing space. Breakfast, amenities and services are spellbound.

34.review_text: 1- Location: Amazing, very central just near and LRT station and walking distance to KLCC - twin tower 2- Apartment: very big apartments, well equipped, and maintained. 3- View, excellent view our room had the twin towers  4- We requested the linked rooms so my mother in law feels safe and can move from our apartment to hers with ease and she loved it 5- Pool, not very good ass it was not heated (indoor pool) but the view from it was great 6- Laundry facility was not easy to use and if you don't stand there throughout your load, someone might actually stop your cycle and put your cloths aside (this happened to us)  7- Staff are very friendly  8- Breakfast buffet was very very very well designed and variate were perfect from local food to international  9- It was difficult to…

35.review_text: Our room was at level 49 with a great view over KLCC. Amazing sunsets! Room is very spacious and clean. Breakfast was decent with a lot of option. The water from the pool was a little bit cold. Otherwise, nothing else to complain about. Staff is very helpfull. The air conditioning kept working even after I switched it off. I asked at the reception for fixing this issue and a team came and turned it completely off.

36.review_text: As a regular in Kuala Lumpur, I got to see the Ilham Tower block the view of my favorite vintage spot on Ambassador Row.  So I gave in & decided I have to accept that the skyline changed & this tower must have a better view.  Looked up my Expedia app, noticed they charge extra $ for View, so I decided it must be worth it & booked a Suite 1 Bedroom with View.  When I arrived, I liked the easy access without the typical glib charm doormen.  The hotel lobby is on the 40th floor right on the thin waist of the tower, in the same floor they have a bar, eatery and what not, made sure the guy understands that I booked the best View Bedroom, he confirmed & was checked into the 1 Bedroom Suite with View.  Being the sensation seeking guy I am, I rushed immediately to the window to enjoy…

37.review_text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. However, the first night we got to the hotel super late. When I went to take a shower, there was a GIANT disgusting wad of hair left on the shower wall. It nearly made me sick. I quickly called the front desk to complain about it and luckily they sent someone up to clean it up. However, this really threw me off as it was my first experience at the hotel. Makes me wonder what other short cuts they are taking and what else is only cleaned on the "surface level".  Besides this, the hotel is quite large and modern with many stories. Going up and down the elevators sometimes took awhile. Breakfast was ample and pretty delicious. Front desk was helpful. Good location close to major sights and walking distance from the MRT station. Good value…

38.review_text: Element by Westin is one of the latest hotel openings in KL. It is very conveniently located in the top floors of the Ilham Tower in KLCC (Floors 39-53 with reception on Level 40). Walking distance to PETRONAS Towers and all KLCC Locations including LRT Ampang. Overall very nice impression with contemporary design with a touch of environmental friendliness as with all Element Hotels.  Really nice and large and clean rooms. Really quiet due to the height of the building.  Beds are a bit too soft in my perception (you realize the impact of the takeover of SPG by Marriott 🥵).  Some really smart details like filtered drinking water in the room by tap avoiding plastic bottles. Clear „go“ for all who want to stay in KLCC

39.review_text: The hotel is very well situated. Service was very good. Good view of KL. Rooms are very spacious with big bed. The small kitchen is very practical as well.   Things to improve: Pool could be heated and open 24/7 since there is a very good view of KL from the pool.   The receptionist did not inform us of the special events happening in the hotel for Christmas and New Year’s Eve. If he did, we would have spent the New Years Eve at the hotel's restaurant itself.

40.review_text: Had a wonderful evening in their coffee house. Trace has variety of local dishes, we had many choices of meat and seafood freshly grilled,the table to table meat carving was a nice touch. Maybe to add some assorted juices/drinks, choices of ice cream will be nice. Staffs was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the lovely view while dining. Overall, it's a good experience.

41.review_text: An awesome service from Mr Ulan with his extra miles, Mr ratsi with his warm welcome till brought and show us our table and the buffet line.. Not to forget Chef Meor tht approach us and recommended us the best food in the buffet... The Chef tht taking care of the omelet station gave me the exact texture of scramble egg tht i requested... And lastly the Lady Chef that taking care of the waffle and pancake station too.. Cant remember their name... Thank you very much with all the awesome and extra miles services..

42.review_text: My wife called on 1 Jan 2020 to make a reservation for 4 sets their Artistry Afternoon Tea for I adults and 2 babies for 25 January 2020 (1st day of CNY) . Call was transferred to the TRACE Restaurant & Bar but no one picked up the call, and it was finally picked up by the customer service/front office again. Reservation was made and confirmed.  Later my wife remembered that she has not mentioned that we have purchased the afternoon tea set through Fave app. So she called a second time later on the same day. When the call was transferred to the dining, this time a guy said to be from F&B picked up the call. My wife informed him that she had made a reservation earlier on that same day but forgot to mention that she will be using the Fave voucher. At that point of time, the guy…

43.review_text: Stayed here for two nights with my friend right before New Years!! The rooms are luxurious, and modern chic. The gentleman that checked us in gave us a view upgrade so I got gaze at Petronas Tower and the other sparkly buildings during the time I was in my room.   Breakfast buffet was very tasty and had a great variety and food at the restaurant was pretty reasonable for dinner. Great service by all whom I came in contact with.    My favorite activity to at the hotel was the pool. Sadly the Elements pool is indoors but has STUNNING views while you swim!!There were three is us at the pool just gazing at the view from the end of pool. BREATHTAKING!    I always ask myself if I would stay at a hotel again and my answer for The Element was an overwhelming yes! I love this place!!…

44.review_text: This is my trip for leasure with my daughter and husband,even though I have arrived at the hotel in the middle of the night, the staff are still very helpful, especially Haiqal from the front desk. Thank you for arranging nice and bigger rooms for us! Breakfast is nice too.. We really enjoyed the holiday. The hotel location was great if you looking to stay closer to Klcc, train station, MEPS Atm machine.  I stayed from 22 Dec - 24 Dec,2019.

45.review_text: Room is clean and spacious, bed is comfortable, overall I'm okay to paid for a room with the room rate but the staff hygiene in the breakfast is terrible. I saw the chef picking up the dried fruit all over the counter and put in back in the jar, there are two senior staffs there did saw that and did not stop the chef. The tong was dropped on the floor but the staff did not change the tong. Food in the breakfast is bad, and the laksa is terrible too. The menu and the promotion did not status clear, the staff refused to take our order, just told us the menu is printed wrong.It's a hotel good to sleep over not to enjoy the F&B.

46.review_text: The rooms are big and spacious and everything was clean. However, there were some minor wear and tears in the room which were already noticeable. The LRT is right around the corner, and you can walk to KLCC if you don’t mind the heat and construction.  Unfortunately, during my second stay at the property, the staff at the front desk seemed to be inattentive compared to my first time there. But will still consider this property due to its competitive prices.

47.review_text: We frequent KL many times a year and hv always stayed at apartments due to our family size of 5. 1st time trying Element and it is definitely a no regret! 1. Convenient sheltered parking with easy access to hotel, at an affordable "per stay" rate which you need to validate daily before heading out. 2. Very clean, spacious & private 2 bedroom unit, enough for our family.  3. Super spacious toilet/bathroom with 2 basins (for e master bedroom toilet) 4. Many TV channels. 5. Fully equipped kitchen, with filtered water dispenser, stove, mini fridge, kettle, microwave, even a washing machine room (we didnt use though). 6. Passable breakfast - with egg station & the usual asian fare like fried noodle, porridge, noodle station, bread, nasi dishes, etc... breakfast staffs very young and…

48.review_text: Thank you very much, the housekeeping team and sales (Yulia) for helping me to surprise my wife’s birthday. She is very happy with beautiful decoration and cute balloons. Thank you for taking care us.

49.review_text: Element by Westin is a newer facility in the KL area.  I stayed in the skyline king studio it was nice but all the rooms don’t have a great view of the Petronas towers so paying the extra money wasn’t worth it.  The facility’s lobby is on 40th floor and the rooms are till 53rd floor.  The hotel is nice and clean and has an indoor pool as well.  I wasn’t as impressed because the concierge wasn’t well equipped and isn’t 24 hours, I requested a transport to the hotel which was eventually arranged but the first response was that we need to inform them 24 hours in advance. I was also not able to rent a car.  The biggest problem was that there was no smoking area inside the hotel and I had to go down 50 floors every time and then I had to go outside the hotel parking to the designated…

50.review_text: Its been a while since my last stay over Element Kuala Lumpur and I went back for my weekend staycation.  Prior to the stay I have confirmed with Mr Ismail on bringing in my electric scooter and was getting a green light. This is the only few hotel that allowed me to bring my electric scooter into the room for safe keeping instead at the concierge which makes me wanted to come back more frequent.  During check-in, I was being given a generous upgrade to 1-bedroom skyline suite with KLCC / KL Tower view which was much appreciated for the recognition on my Marriott Bonvoy membership status.  Pool is stunning but the heated water seems not working as the water is dead cold and you can barely swim for long due to the indoor position. However, location is ideal with 2 min walk to the…

51.review_text: If you are looking nice but yet affordable hotel with great location, this is the place. Located few meters away from LRT Ampang Park and accessible to KLCC by walking distance. Nice room ambience with great KLCC view (skyline view)

52.review_text: Stayed here for a night during my birthday!  Stayed on the 52nd floor and it showcased a very beautiful view of the city.  For some reason, the bed was not very comfortable. It was too soft for me. It was not to my liking.  Apart from that, it was a very nice stay.

53.review_text: - Good services, beautiful room, good take care from sales and staff.  - Good breakfast but not many kind of food.  - Good and beautiful view from my room.  - Warm swimming pool.  - Internet connected fitness machine but few ones.

54.review_text: Nice breakfast, good location e.g. close to subway station that can go to klcc or kl central (hub to airport), grocery store & food (in the Intermark building), 24hr fitness, and indoor swimming pool. To go to Pavilion, you have to take free bus (go kl) green line.

55.review_text: I have an work assignment in Malaysia for 3 years and Element kuala lumpur is the first choice where I choose to stay. Here, all staffs have very good service mind, friendly and willing to welcome all of you. Fully recommended to stay here.

56.review_text: Very nice place to stay in KL, especially for business since it's so close to KLCC. Next to Ampang park station as well.  Excellent service as well.  Also with good facilities, indoor pool and decent size 24 hrs gym.

57.review_text: We stayed here for three nights and loved it. The staff is super friendly, rooms are fantastic and it’s walking distance from Petronas towers and many nice restaurants. The hotel restaurant is busy but nice and affordable.

58.review_text: Great stay  Nice room and very helpful staffs....  Good gym and facility ...  Good location ...  10 mins to KLCC downtown ...   3 mins walk to subway stations ...  5 mins walk to bus stop ...  Very pleasant stay ...  Will stay again ...

59.review_text: I recently spent 3 nights here on business.  The hotel is exceptionally clean and the breakfast is very well done with many choices.  The rooms are all suites with a small kitchenette area.  The beds have the "heavenly mattress" so you will sleep well on a soft but supportive bed.  Service can be a bit slow sometimes and attention to detail (like replacing the coffee pods) can get overlooked.  A solid business hotel.

60.review_text: I’ll be honest, I am usually not a big fan of the brand, but I like this property for the amazing views and the pool.  Element Kuala Lumpur is located on the top part of the building. This is actually a green building so there are some kinks that I needed time to get used to. It is currently the tallest eco-friendly hotel in the city.  Service here is decent and prompt. Recognition is good. I love the fact that they have a fully functional kitchen that we could do our own cooking. The gym view is pretty amazing. I’m totally in love with it. I don’t think I’ve ever been to a gym that frequent as I do here in any other place. Great pool, but however it isn't a heated pool any more. Lights were not lit as much as it use to be and the pool seems to be dull. The pool itself is an…

61.review_text: Spent 1 night at the fabulous hotel. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite on 51st floor... simply stunning views over the city... only wished we were here more than 1 night. Lovely breakfast and pool facilities would highly recommend.

62.review_text: One of the best hotel in the area under the marriot group. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff is very attentive but a little slow when there are maby people.  The views feom the room is amazing and the price is very reasonable for KLCC area.  Stayed at the 2 bedroom suite.

63.review_text: Stay there during Deepavali and was amazed with the quality of bedding ( Westin / Marriot kinda style and comfy ).   The check in is a breeze at level 39/40 with a view of megatalls tower surrounding the area. This hotel offers you a modern and sleek accommodation for young and modern guest.   Breakfast spread is good. The egg station is there to serve you their fluffy omelette.   Toiletries: Pharmacopia (brand).

64.review_text: Nice view, super clean and comfortable room. All stuff are very friendly and helpful especially Ms.Ira. She is very helpful and patient. Thanks you to ms.ira and also all the stuff. Will definitely come back again !

65.review_text: I stayed three nights at this hotel in November 2019. The service on arrival was excellent (cases were kindly taken to my room), check-in was super easy and the room was clean and cool. I like the fact that drinking water was available from a tap in the room. Good bed and bathroom too. The breakfast was excellent. The staff were all so friendly which really made my short business stay extra nice! Thank you. I will be returning. Natalie

66.review_text: It's a beautiful hotel, I've visited couple of times as my friend is a Plat member but never stayed here before. This time, I've decided to put a few nights just to check it out.  Upon arrival, I requested for a suite as I've noticed the room availability was quite high, however, they just didn't want to allocate it to me and allocate most of their suites to everyone else (perhaps other plat/titanium members) with the usual excuse being full but it's actually available. After a few ugly emails, they decided to give the Skyline view suite, but later on stripped the skyline view and just the suite with the other side of the view. It was totally unnecessary afterall the occupancy wasn't full. Upon check in, the usual, greet and apologise this happened. If my friend who is a Gold is…

67.review_text: I am fairly particular about the cleanliness of the hotel and element is clean and comfortable. It spacious and layout is great. The hotel is green oriented and do not have bottle water but instead a under counter water filtration system by 3M for clean drinking water! Thumbs up for that. The only challenges I had is the booking problem via Marriott Bonvoy. Booked more than a month ago but when I reached there  tired, the hotel reception can’t find my booking! Not their fault but I believe is booking system problem via Marriott Bonvoy, the lady Sarawak is very helpful and still manage to secure a room for me. That’s a saving grace imho. It will be a 5-star if not for the booking problem.

68.review_text: upon arrival i was met with great service smile by the concerige and the reception was brilliant the room its self was spectacular with the best view of kl and petronas,loved it all,the breakfast area was amazing the food and selection very deverse and the staff welcome me with a smile nothing was ever a issue i loved it

69.review_text: I didn't know there is a hotel in the building.  Located at the high level of the building, the view of KL it offers is stunning.   The facilities are superb. The room is big and the bed is so comfy. There is nothing that I don't like about my stay. I only wish I could stay longer.

70.review_text: Needed an urgent stay and unable to reservation a room after midnight. Contacted the front desk and agreed to backdate my next day reservation so that I can check-in and rest for few hours.   New hotel with nice view at attractive last minute rate. Helpful team.

71.review_text: Arrived late morning from the airport and asked to check in early. This was arranged after a few minutes wait. The room was very spacious, clean and modern with great views towards Ampang and Genting Highlands from the 51st floor. The bed was very large and comfortable.  The buffet breakfast was very good although not as good as some of the other major hotels in KL.  The hotel has a very nice indoor swimming pool on the 39th floor although I was surprised how cold it was. It also has a laundry room with washing machines and dryers  which were good and cheap to use.  Location is very good with KLCC just 10 minutes walk away. Finally all the staff were very friendly and helpful.

72.review_text: I stayed at hotel for 3 nights. Firstly, i was so impressed with friendly service. However, on the second day, i lost the Iphone box. Luckily, i took the Iphone out, and still only the accessories like charger and headphone in the box. I made a complaint at reception, but of course what I received as an answer from them like everyone think “Sorry, we checked and found nothing in your room” :-)))

73.review_text: Rooms are clean and the service is great. Used the facilities gym + pool. Everything is well kept. Also used the laundry room. Could not recommend this place more. Short stroll to the Petronas Towers, views of the city is amazing. Would stay again.

74.review_text: Firstly we were greeted by a lovely smiley lady by the name Sylvia.She is doing a great job with in-house guest. She made our stay extra special. Keep up the good work Sylvia!!!  The only negative i would give this hotel is with the 1bedroom apartments they need more furniture in the kitchen area and more light. We found that the lounge room was not inviting We hung out in bedroom alot as it was not so dark both rooms have 2different looks i think this will help with more furniture. We will be back😊😊😊😊

75.review_text: My friend, Divi, and I went to the bar of the Element Kuala Lumpur on 19th November 2019. The scenery from the 40th floor is very beautiful and we really love the clean and modern ambience. The bartender, Hariz, is also very friendly and he served us very well. We are really satisfied with the service. Thank you, Hariz, and Element KL team.

76.review_text: I like that the hotel takes its greening efforts seriously. There is no bottled water in the room, in place of it is a filtered tap and they take it upon themselves to conserve energy without compromising on the comfort of the guest. The pool is lovely and views from every room is a skyline view. Only downside is that we probably have to walk a few more minutes to the nearest shopping mall, which is ok. That means less noise and less people in the area. Alternatively, Grab is convenient as well!

77.review_text: The nitty gritty:  I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  Sylvia helped at check in and had a very friendly attitude, as well as every staff I met at the property.  The view was fantastic and the room was very spacious.  Can't wait to go back!

78.review_text: My first time trying out the Element brand. Upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was a nice start to the weekend. Very quiet in the bedroom (since there was some additional sound insulation from the lounge area). Functional bathroom with separate bath and shower. Business district location with few cafes and bars nearby. Major mrt construction work in the vicinity during my visit which made walking access to KLCC troublesome. Close to the Ampang Park mrt station. Comfortable super king size bed. Free wifi worked well. Small indoor infinity pool. Very good value for money.

79.review_text: If you have a budget and looking for long stay, this is the one! Location is just next to LRT in city center. The lobby is at level 40. Privacy is good. I picked   A studio unit, the space is big, room clean and neat.   I liked the facility they provide inside the room. Fridge Microwave to heat up your meal,cutlery set, basin with soap for dish wash. It so convenient!   Certainly, will come back again.

80.review_text: We stayed at the Element KL for 4 days in October 2019. We had a suite on the 46th floor and are a family of three. The hotel arranged an extra bed for us which was comfortable. The kitchen is fully equipped with anything and everything you can think of. The view of the KL skyline is awesome. However the room has some extra space in the living room which could have been used efficiently such as by adding another couch. Lifts were nice but we had to wait for a long time for one to come. The breakfast setting was admirable but there was hardly anything to eat since we are vegetarians. The buffet was only meat and the same for all days.

81.review_text: The hotel is just awesome. Ticks all the boxes. The room had the best view of the city, Petronas Towers and the KL Tower. The room had it's one private kitchen, complete with sink, cutlery and a microwave oven. Impeccably clean and white. It's in the heart of the city, the Petronas Towers is walking distance. But the best thing about the hotel is the view from the room. I just sat there with a coffee in hand and gazed at the view. A definite recommend

82.review_text: Hotel is really nice , good location, very new and eco friendly. But it’s been a month since we stayed there and I had a reservation for 2 rooms in their hotel. Upon check in u double checked with the reception if I’m getting Bonvoy points for both reservations. I’ve been following for a month now and still they didn’t add the points for the second room stay. I think it’s a lack of fills up and the team upon check-in supposed to double check as well.

83.review_text: Very friendly staff, helpful, go extra mile, Great Room clean , very comfy Bed and pillows, Great bathroom, Great presure, near subway an 5 min walk to klcc or Petrobras towers,   Con, tv Chanel with only 2 english Chanel for and hbo

84.review_text: The hospitality is great.  The Malaysian people are so friendly and hospitable.  The space of the rooms are brilliant, no little boxes like you get in Europe.  The hotel is kept spotless.  The location in the business district really works as one can have a little stroll to enjoy the nightlife of KL but also benefit from the peace and quiet to enjoy a restful stay.  It was strange to begin with as during the week the first thirty nine floors are offices and the hotel reception is on the 40th floor. There is a hotel bar by the reception and there is also an entertainment bar, generally for the office staff but they allow hotel guests to use. The bar has outside balconies with fantastic views. I think the bar was on the 35th floor.

85.review_text: This is probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in KL. An excellent location in the heart of the city.  The rooms are new and really spacious.  The service is just outstanding. Was really impressed by Lisa at the front office, Sadik at the restaurant and Doris the manager. Can’t wait to come back.

86.review_text: This hotel is brilliant. The location is ideal, close to everything anyone ever needs in this very busy city.  The reception (40th floor) was extremely quick efficient. The rooms (ours was on the 45th floor) are spacious, light and extremely comfortable. The breakfast served in the restaurant on the 40th floor was superb with a great selection of cuisines.  RECOMMENDATION GUARANTEED!

87.review_text: Was upgraded to one bedroom suite upon checked in. Room was big and spacious and great unblocked view except for the haze, else would be perfect. Front desk was friendly and patient, housekeeping was attentive to details. Hotel surrounding was quiet due to its location in business district hence weekend is very quiet to my delight. One LRT stop to KLCC, can even walk there. One of the hotel definitely in my list when I visit KL again

88.review_text: I decide to purchase the birthday package as it was quite a nice deal. Got upgraded to the 53 floor where’s the highest floor and a KLCC view. The room is as usual nice and big comfy bed.   Overall the stay is wonderful and nothing to complain. I finally get a chance to use the swimming pool, the tiles beneath the pool is beautiful! Just the water is too freezing cold. The warm water start to pumps in when I about to leave. However I wish there’s more pool chairs to let people sit.   The breakfast in the morning was decent, the coffee is nice and the buffet spread is sufficient. The service is good and the smiles from the service people make my day.   Well the only hiccup was I got a call from the desk about 1230 asking me this question “Do you know what is the time now?”. I…

89.review_text: After having moved out of the awful Majestic. The element was a real breath of fresh air. Situated inside a brand new skyscraper in the shadow of the petronass Twin Towers, this hotel is very very well located and close proximity to the intercontinental. Extremely modern the decor is very nice and clean.  Reception is on the 40th floor and I was given a room on the 44th floor. Avoid if you have any fear of heights. The lift is super fast and you hardly notice how far u have to travel.  The room was quite modern and had a small kitchenette. There is also a small supermarket Close to the entrance of the hotel where you can buy snacks or food.  Pool And Gym are on the 37th floor. The view from the pool is quite extraordinary.  Internet speed was excellent.  Didn’t sample of…

90.review_text: I was there for an event at the Era room recently. To be honest, I love going back to this hotel because of its central location in Kuala Lumpur and easy access via the Ampang Park LRT station. The lobby is located at Level 40 at the Ilham Building which also housed one of the best galleries in the city. One thing I really love about this hotel is their food. We were served delicious tea break right after the event. Earlier this year, I had a lunch at the hotel during the Ramadan month and it was a memorable experience sitting by the window looking out at the amazing KL view while having our 4-course meal. I would recommend this place but do make your reservation because the hotel restaurant can get really packed and busy these days.

91.review_text: We stayed for 2 nights in the 2 bedroom suite and loved every bit of it. Very spacious and comfy beds. Full kitchen amenities, 3M filtered drinking water tap, a short walk to KLCC and Tapak Foodtruck Park. A good 30% discount for dining at Trace Restaurant. Great breakfast and it was a nice escape to the indoor pool with the bad hazy weather. Would definitely come back and stay here again!

92.review_text: In the center of the city, next to KJL station, convenient store down stairs, location is good. The common area big and bright, breakfast has a very good spread; i thought it caters to the international crowd... the local food selection is so so.  The room is good size, working table useable, i would like it to be bigger. Air conditioning, bath room all good.   The note in the room says hotel uses 3M filters on tap for drinking water, supposedly environmental friendly. I hope the filtered water is good.

93.review_text: My friends and I rent the 2 room apartment for a friend's birthday. We ended up 12 people in the apartment and enjoyed the spacious of the room. The staffs are so helpful and friendly to our requests. Also the front desk is so professional and compromising, able to remember every requests I asked for. Definitely I highly recommend this hotel for family or friends gathering.

94.review_text: Friendly staff. Water at indoor pool is chilly. Breakfast is acceptable for 30%discount. Nice view as all rooms start from floor 41 if not mistaken. Have convenience store at ground level that open up till late night. Very near to klcc, within walking distance.

95.review_text: The hotel is centrally located but yet still in a quiet area of Kuala Lumpur.  The front desk was helpful and accommodating.  The views from the hotel and room were spectacular.  However, the rooms overall could be cleaner.  Upon check in the sheets and bed were quite stained upon other things.  I had notified the front desk of the issue and housekeeping came and remedied the issue promptly.  However, I would expect that for a guest checking in this wouldn't be something I would need to have to do.  Also the bathroom showered was quite stained with mildew.  Not sure if they ever do a deep cleaning of the tile / shower but it is something I would recommend.

96.review_text: Great hotel centrally located, breakfast superb, rooms vaery spacious and clean, chose to dine in one evening food lovely, service very slow 20 mins to clear plates asked for dessert menu they never came back come on guys get your act together

97.review_text: Firstly I was able to check in early which was a real bonus after 17hrs travelling. Suggest you go for Skyline suite and make sure looks towards Petronas Towers - whilst you can't see the whole tower (The Four Seasons hotel is in the way) I never got tired of the view day or night. Room spacious and probably the most comfortable bed I have slept on (bar The Westin Doha) for a long time. Bathroom very nice. Breakfast great and varied selection and pool with a view to die for! Location not only very convenient for Petronas Towers and shopping mall but also LRT and buses to major attractions, 2 minor complaints - surface in kitchenette badly stained so looked dirty all the time and mould around floor in shower - something I never like to see in my house let alone a hotel. Apart…

98.review_text: Element KL is now undoubtedly one of our favourite hotels in KL.   What we love:  - Fantastic location (near to KLCC and LRT station)  - Heated indoor pool  - Spacious, minimalistic room - Gorgeous view from top floor - Ample parking spaces  - Top notch in hospitality service! Special shout out to Leanne (reception area), because she is never seen without a smile on her face and she'd always greet us with a warm welcome. So much pleasure when she's the one handling our check-in, thank you, Leanne.   What we don't love: - Not a very kids friendly kind of hotel as there is no wading pool or kids room. There's only 1 cartoon channel on the TV which doesn't work most of the time. I'd like it better if they offer Disney Junior channel as it's more suitable for toddlers and younger…

99.review_text: LOCATION it doesnt that killer prime position but its still a good one. 10 minutes walk to Suria KLCC and Twin Tower. Theres famous Tapak, street food truck, 5 minutes from the hotel  ROOM spacious, well designed, AC works very good, wifi is blazing fast. nothing to complain at all  GYM AND POOL beautiful pool and decent gym.   FOOD delicious and has a very good price value  OVERALL EXPERIENCE with quite cheap price tag, this one is another top pick for me when in Kuala Lumpur. for sure a coming back

100.review_text: Good location to KLCC shopping complex and the view from the hotel room is great!  Breakfast is good and the swimming pool is special to have at indoor. I will recommend this hotel to m y friends. Well, will consider to return on my next trip to KL.

The RuMa Hotel and Residences, Kuala Lum.address: 7 Jalan Kia Peng, Kuala Lumpur 50450 Malaysia

1.review_text: It was our first time at the RuMa. Everything was beyond my expectation. Everything was great. It was a bit pricy but worth the money. My family enjoyed it very much and we will certainly come back next time. The best hotel in Kuala Lumpur so far. Congratulations The RuMa Hotel and staff, you guys made my day!

2.review_text: This hotel was chosen in celebration of my wife's birthday and our anniversary, The reservation team did an exemplary job of assisting me through email and calls. Very attentive and detailed. As an interior designer, I'm impressed with the level of details that makes the entire hotel a poetic and aesthetically pleasing experience.   The receptionist greeted me as I was still approximately 4 feet away from the counter, her tone was friendly and genuine. I was briefed in detail about my stay and the facilities within the hotel and my room.   Special thanks to the butler team in the setup of the bedroom with flower petals and balloons to support my wife's birthday surprise. During the span of our stay, we were presented with cakes for our birthday and also apples with a welcome letter.  While there are a lot of luxurious and expensive hotel around the city, this hotel manage to distinguish itself through the basic fundamental of hospitality : Service.  You can feel their generosity throughout the stay, you will never feel anything pushy, most importantly, you felt that it's worth every penny spent.   Dear Ruma team, You’ve proven to us that the “Hostmanship” is not just a marketing tagline on your website, and we’ve experience how serious you guys are with it.  We are very much impressed, and this will definitely not be the last time we are staying at the RUMA.…

3.review_text: Enjoyed my stay here. Love their 24hours flexible check in and check out time. I do not have to rush back after breakfast session. There are still room for improvement here and there. Bedsheet was stained upon check in, but was changed quickly upon request. While having our breakfast at ATAS Restaurant, there wasn’t anyone to assist us initially, might be overwhelmed with the crowds, but everything was alright afterwards. Great stay!

4.review_text: Decided to take my wife for her birthday at Atas Modern Malaysian Eatary. The food was 10/10 and better than that was the service. It was out of this world. Will definitely go back there again and would recommend it to all my family and friends. Kudos to the Team at Atas.

5.review_text: Komalah from reservations was very helpful and so attentive in replying my emails. Eventhough it was last minute but she was so flexible in dealing with my request. From the first check in until the day i depart everything was awesome, Santai was so cozy and relaxing which i truly love it! The ird staff was super friendly and cheerful. I just love everything about this hotel. Wish to be back again! Thank you everyone for the great service. It was super awesome!

6.review_text: It was my first time dining at Atas Modern Malaysian Eatery at the Ruma hotel and all I can say is it was one of the most amazing time I’ve had in a long time!  Great ambience and beautiful at every corner!  The food was great and the service was amazing!   Thank you to the Atas team, Bell, Adi and Deva and their manager for making my birthday a memorable one! Will definitely come back! Great food and even greater service

7.review_text: A very strategic location at golden triangle area, 5 minutes walk to Pavilion and other famous shopping center, staffs are friendly and polite, the room is clean and cozy. It is quite pity we did not have much time to visit the pool and spa, will definitely check in again!

8.review_text: Clean and comfortable. My suggestion there must be an iron in the hotel room to all for stay at hotel especially for couples to honeymoon. Good service from staff. Nearest to KLCC. Delicious food and service.

9.review_text: 1. If you travel with kids, always go for Deluxe Suite for spacious room and 2 smart TV. 2. Again, go for Deluxe Suite if you care about the view. 3. Will be good if the front desk staff can call to remind on the evening canapes at SANTAI on LEVEL 6. May consider in-room dining as well (too crowded at pool area). 4. The number of snacks and drinks should be balanced. More drinks than snacks at the minibar during my stay. 5. Please let the guests know on room service hour. I made a call at 7am plus utilized the room service light, but only being attended at noon. 6. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

10.review_text: A Good experience for birthday celebration on hotel preparation, and my kids loved the hotel so much because is was so cozy & comfortable. will definitely return back for next time. thank you so much for the staff service.

11.review_text: Booked a room  for my best friend and I to have some girl time before my big day -- Needless to say, we enjoyed our stay!  The hotel's location makes it extremely convenient. It takes literally less than 2 minutes to walk to KLCC, which means the LRT and MRT are equally nearby.   Everything was top-notch. Staff, ambiance, cleanliness, etc.   Based on the symphony of snores I woke up to in the morning, I can confidently say that the sleep quality was met with 5 stars.   Thank you RuMa, for the pleasant stay! We'll definitely be coming back again ;)

12.review_text: I stay with my family here. Its meet my expectation about 5 star hotel. The food and the service beyond my expectation. The most i like about this hotel we can check in early the morning and check out until late, not other hotel can offer. All the staff very friendly.

13.review_text: Quality of property and aesthetics were high, the 24 hour check in indeed live to their promise (but no turndown service). But service during check in check out falls below expectation. Nobody brings you to your room either. Food service at the pool was lacking of staff. Really not what is expected of a 5 star hotel.

14.review_text: very suitable for couple & we used as celebrate our anniversary, very good atmosphere, but 1 thing happened: i go out a while (maybe 2 hour) after finished check in, and maybe staff in hotel go in to my room as the time i come back the bed become messy. It is quite bad feeling.

15.review_text: Have returned a few times, still feels like i am not in KL but i am actually here. The food is amazing at any time and location! Bed is super comfy! Everything is high quality top notch and yet the staffs make you feel at home and not some posh snobbish hotel.   Posh comfort!

16.review_text: Love everything about this hotel especially the Room or should we call it The Ruma. The amenities, the mini bar is top notch. But maybe can improve on the ATAS  buffet breakfast - not so many choices available.

17.review_text: would definitely come back with my boyfriend again. Sooo comfy ! The room is clean, good smell, the whole ambient is good. Staffs all are friendly, location just walking distance to pavilion or klcc. And thank you theruma for the birthday surprise! :)

18.review_text: Perfect for a staycation in the city!!I will definitely  come back for another staycation and celebration.The twin tower view is another plus point for The Ruma.And they are so generous by providing a complimentary mini bar to the guests.Kudos to all the teams.

19.review_text: i stay here to surprise and celebrate my husband's birthday. i seek for the staff assistance at the very last minute, and they provide at their best to surprise my husband. you wont regret staying at the RuMa. everything is good and my kid also enjoying it staying here. strategic location, 3mins walking to KLCC park and pavilion mall. and definitely it's Instagrammable!

20.review_text: This is the best hotel I stayed in KL so far , their service is amazing ! The room is clean and beautiful , 24 hours fleck check in and out , free daily mini bar , their food is great . Their staff is so friendly and helpful  You are so comfortable which makes you feel like you in  home (Rumah)  Would definitely recommend ! And come back for sure

21.review_text: Superb rooms with luxurious comfy beds. Loved the amenities provided in room. Service was par excellent. We were gutted that the SPA was priced premium, and that the pool bar only offered "happy hour' pricing. We really wanted to do more activities and spend more time and money inhouse rather than going out and risk infection during this period. Breakfast quality however was adequately just OK. I'd rate it 5/10. Nothing to shout about

22.review_text: MCO after MCO and with limited available rooms, we finally manage the secure our room in Ruma. My husband and I were impressed with the elegant design of the hotel and fast check-in. Only we wish that we can get a smile from the staffs, none till the end of our check-out time. Everyone seems so stressed out. Even the SOPs has been changed in Kuala Lumpur, we still have to eat our breakfast in our room instead of the restaurant. The food was great, but sadly it's turned out cold when it's arrived.

23.review_text: Okay fine. Review this hotel yes? Okay. You see last week we were at the Ritz. Flex, flex yes. Wasn't too impressed. Paid double this rate. And so we come to this place. Whoa! Like seriously. Ok... attention to detail... yes! It's like an OCD person designed this room with comparments for spoon in the drawers and all. Yes yes. Good good. Complimentary drinks and snacks in the fridge? Yes... What?? Excellent!! High tech room with one click WiFi...!! yess!! usb charging ports!! yess!! HDMI and airplay and BT audio? are you kidding me? yess!! New nespresso way of making them coffee... Good! Good coffee! Reading chair? Thankss! We asked for baby chair and they came in and gave us chair, cot, potty, tub, and baby care pack!! whatttt?  Service is excellent, treats you like a king.…

24.review_text: Friendly and attentive staff. Gorgeous rooms and interiors. Great pillow selection. Nice dinner ambience at Atas, food is eclectic and tasty. A nice surprise even for a second time stay. Lives up to their LWH and Hostmanship values!

25.review_text: It has been my 8th or 9th time, I have lost count on how many times I have been there. Always good to be back, staff are always welcoming and its nice to be recognized by the staff when you are back. Anyway I just experience a slight hiccup when could not reach in room dining, even though I have call few times. Other than that, it has been a great stay like always. I would like to commend Front Desk staff Naiman for always recognizing me when I'm back and also In-room dining staff Aishah (mummy) always friendly service. I would like also to commend Santai and pool bar staff, I didn't catch his name.

26.review_text: Feels like 'HOME' at The RuMa Hotel & Residence. Kami stay for 2d1n at Deluxe Suite. The ambiance was so nice. Rasa macam dekat rumah haha Staff nice and peramah. Paling best dapat flexi 24 hours check in & check out. Rasa tak rugi langsung spend for this hotel. Very recommended. Dinner and breakfast sedap and pelbagai. View dari bilik (deluxe suite) menghadap KLCC, serious superB!!! Bilik and katil luas and selesa. Bathtub pun with KLCC view! Surely will come back again.

27.review_text: Amazing experience from c/in until c/out process. The room on top of the class, we really love the environment even-thought the hotel located in middle of busy city. All staff very friendly and very helpful, especially Nainman (Butler) we had an amazing memorable stay with The Ruma. We will definitely come back to the hotel next time.

28.review_text: The best value of money I ever spent for a 5 star hotel. Spacious comfortable room, generous amount of complimentary stuffs, and a great place for a relaxing staycation even for a family despite being at the center of a city.

29.review_text: Love this Hotel so much, I would say it is one of my Top hotels after traveling in various country. And I was surprised that the best hotel in my life is located in my country Malaysia. The room was high-tech, yet with a tasteful Malay design over it. The room is clean and the service was great.   Will sure be my number 1 recommended hotel in KL

30.review_text: The movement when I walk in the Hotel, Mr Hisham bring me in to check our body temperature and he lead us to the main lobby, Mr Ezaz and Ms Prissha welcoming us at the lobby and explained the Golden Baju Kurung. We are here to celebrating our anniversary at ATAS restaurant, food are stunning! Thanks to Mr Bell, Mr Firdaus, Mr Vincent and whole FnB team. Thanks to Mr Rafiky gave us a very warm fond Farewell and lead us to carpark. I will definitely come back again.

31.review_text: awesome experience, all staff is very friendly. Room so clean and have a nice design. Bed is so comfortable. We all got deep sleep night. walking distance to the pavillion. Overall i really love this hotel and for sure will come back again

32.review_text: Having an awesome high-tea at The Ruma with my friends. Home-liked environment with SOP create a comfortable and safe surrounding for us. In addition, new insights and knowledges was gained after a detailed introduction from Adriannna on each of the desserts and pastries served. A satisfying service from Fariz on serving our food and beverage. Lastly, we were entertained by Bell and Khai while enjoying our high-tea. We were impressed and wish to visit again. Thank you!

33.review_text: Came back the 2nd time to have the high-tea at The Ruma. This time with my friends and we all truly enjoyed the ambience and service given by Adrianna and Fariz from Seven. We were also entertained by Bell and Khai who lived up to the hostmanship as promised by The Ruma.  We totally love the environment and the crowd is well managed. All following SOP and not overcrowding during our visit. However we would like to sincerely ask the chef to relook on their choice of pastries / desserts menu served as some of the food has really odd/weird/unusual pairing of ingredients (November's afternoon tea - the blue theme was wayyyy better than this round's menu). Although we truly understand the specialty of menu but making delicate and delicious food compliment your environment even more. …

34.review_text: Loved it, the ambience, interior, service were wonderful. We had breakfast in the room because the restaurant was not opened on weekday, but I found the hot chocolate a bit underwhelming, but the rest of food was acceptable. Nevertheless, I wont hesitate to make my next booking when the chance arises!

35.review_text: Had a very pleasant staycation in RuMa. I love the great feature of The RuMa is its 24-hour check-in/check-out service, i.e. you can check-in and check-out any time you wish. Not forget another feature of The RuMa is the complimentary mini-bar in every room which is replenished daily. The services provided by every staff is superb. Will definitely come back again!

36.review_text: We had enjoyed a wonderful stay in this hotel. The hotel and the room design is artistic, all lighting and window shade fixtures are centrally controlled in the room. We are able to adjust the lightings to our liking.  One highlight is their flexi check in and check out arrangement. We were able to fully utilize hotel facilities to our own schedule. Their services are exceptional, special thanks to Jason, Kiki and Angela for their remarkable services during our stay!

37.review_text: They are the friendliest hotel staff ever. I just made a call to confirm on the 24hours check in check out, and they were so amazing. The tone of talking, its like they really embrace the art of communication and so honest. I just can't wait to book and experience the service. Well done RuMa! Sorry I forgot to capture the name of first staff and managed to get second, Angela.

38.review_text: From the welcome to the stay everything here screams comfort and style. Love the cozy, subtle, quiet and Serene athmosphere. It's just a class of it's own. When in KL always choose the Ruma! You will forget that you are actually right in the middle of the busy city center.

39.review_text: We were really happy and appreciate on the flexible check in/out and daily free minibar facility. The ambience, room, food, staff, everything were at excellent level. Sure we will stay in The Ruma again soon.

40.review_text: Loved the place! Everyone was very friendly and the service team was very prompt whenever we had enquiries. Would recommend for staycation. Very near to both KLCC and Pavilion which was a treat. Close to Grand Hyatt too (for dining in Thirty8)

41.review_text: 1. Friendly and welcoming front house staffs. Straight-forward registration procedures during mco, welcoming drinks served. Very detailed briefing on what services available during mco period. 2. Pool and gym were accesible when we checked in, but we were not prepared for outdoor activities. 3. The room feels really spacious, minimal yet sleek fixtures/furnitures. Big points for the less loose furniture in the room (ie: some hotels do have a lot of empty drawers and furniture). All drawers were filled with useful condiments, cutleries, small plates, 3 types of glasses, etc. No drawers and furniture left emptied. 4. Complimentary mini bar - soft drinks, more than 2 bottles of mineral water, tidbits (muruku, mini dodol & kacang tumbuk) --- so traditional! 5. Hands down to the…

42.review_text: Friendly staff. Love the early check in and late check out facilities. It does suit the concept of “rumah”. Breakfast were great. All staff always great you with smile. Will come again for sure. Thanks

43.review_text: Good experience, extremely clean and comfortable and super good services and in room dining experience. Spacious room  And toilet. Efficient room services and concierge. I will definitely come back again!

44.review_text: Had the six course dinner set..rm248++, IMO quite worth it and reasonable, very “ malaysianised” altho I feel there’s space for improvement eg going wilder with the taste :)  Was served by Bell - great service!! Very friendly and cheerful :)  overall enjoyed my experience dining alone here

45.review_text: I would like to thank Bell and Khai for trying their level best to make me feel comfortable (and less awkward) after they found out that I have to dine in at ATAS alone as my partner couldn't make it for our staycation and dinner due to last minute work commitment. Not to forget, their attention to details where they gave me a belated birthday surprise to cheer me up. A big thank you to the SANTAI Pool Bar & Lounge Team for making the surprise happen too.  Indeed the best hostmanship in town that serves you with their heart. Thank you once again.

46.review_text: My Husband and I stayed here over the weekend. I left the next day and forgot my medications in the fridge. I called the front desk and not only they found my medications but their Staff : Nivashinee Sivaraja immediately got a grab delivery (express) to send it to my home. She paid for the delivery (because it wouldn’t accept cash payment) and refused to allow me to bank in for her. I am amazed how great the staffs are and even personal whereby they treat you like family.

47.review_text: My family and I enjoyed our stay very much! Everything was top notch, their service and hospitality are excellent. Its a prime location if you want to stay in the city, we only travel on foot because everything is close by, roughly 6-8 mins walk to KLCC or Pavilion. Btw, you would definitely enjoy the breakfast, we certainly did! My son loved the pandan pancake so much, i had to remake it at home. Hehe. Thank you Ruma! It was such a pleasant stay!!

48.review_text: Made arrangements with RuMa via Agoda for our 5th wedding anniversary staycation. Agoda coordinated with RuMa accordingly via emails and the service was excellent even before we checked in. Was gladly pleased with some of the generous VIP upgrades for tea time meals and the mini bar. The room was so beautiful and the staff decorated it with rose petals for the occasion. Housekeeping even responded very fast at 1am and two staff came just to deliver a stiffer pillow! The whole hotel was an artful delight for the senses and grammable pictures. We also had our scrumptious fine dining at The Atas restaurant and was superbly attended by Deva, and again by him at breakfast. Outstanding service! Felt like we were in a 6-7 star hotel. Amazing experience all the way right til check out.…

49.review_text: The room was superb and clean and the bathtub was awesome. Staff were friendly and helpful too. But the breakfast was not a buffet, and the selection card was only one for both me and my partner, so it was hard to write down the selections and we recieved some different meals instead.

50.review_text: 1) flex check-in and check out is a plus point 2) the minibar is good 3) Just not happy with the in-room limited breakfast selection. I prefer the buffet which has more and better selection. I stay 3 nights but only able to enjoy the buffet breakfast on the 1st night.

51.review_text: Is a super nice stay. Just a little bit disappointed with their breakfast session only. Because due to the  pandemic, buffet style is change to ala cart style. But feel like lack of employee on floor for the breakfast session, cause hard to grab attention when wanna order, and keep miss out our orders. make us feel not having a nice good breakfast mood.

52.review_text: Fine touch that is unbeatable in hospitality, amazing choice of decor from the entrance all the way to the room, smart lighting features, fluffy pillows and mattress yet firm for an assured sleep rest, toiletries champion - the bath salt works exceedingly!, consistence housekeeping and hospitality, staff are always  tentative at all time, the f&b at SANTAI - tip top staff and really made my experience a memorable one from the stay, easy check in and check out, also... complimentary minibar.  Only comment i have is the inconsistence breakfast food - 3 breakfast and it never taste the same, delicious still but could be better.   Almost every angle at RuMa is photogenic. Bring your love ones for a satisfying stay. Highly recommended.

53.review_text: Thumbs up to the employees especially Raj, Kiki and Wani. You have made my stay extremely pleasant and welcoming. The food was good, the room was comfortable and we even managed to use to gym which was very comfortable. The hotel comply with SOP and there seems to be multiple hand sanitizers laying around which makes me feel safe and convenient. Thank you.

54.review_text: One of the best hotel in KL , top notch service by all the staff , the hotel and staff provides you a very warm and welcoming feeling, which suits its name " The Ru-Ma" and the best part is they provide 24hours room service , and flexible check in (as early as 8-10am check in!)  and check out (as late as 8-11pm check out!)

55.review_text: nice hotel with modern design  room comfy and clean there's bath up that you can use your bath bomb near to KLCC and pavilion - walking distance great breakfast taste awesome nice small pool with great scenery

56.review_text: We stayed for one night here during new year’s (prior to that we stayed at The Majestic for 2 nights and had exceptional service). The hotel came highly recommended by a friend. They have the option whether to have breakfast in the room or at Atas. We choose the latter. It took an hour or so for our breakfast to arrive and it was just mine. Not even my husband’s! After waiting for so long (and we had a restless toddler with us), we told them to just send the food to our room to which they said they can’t do so but can pack it for us. Our child wanted to swim at it was already 10.30am (we were there since 9am!) but I waited while my husband went to the pool with our child. So once they packed the food, I went to my room. Opened it and saw that there’s no toast, milk, or cereal…

57.review_text: We wholly enjoyed our stay at The Ruma, and are looking forward to our next stay! The staff were friendly, prompt and have made our stay the better. The location was surprisingly close to KLCC Suria which only took 3-5 minutes walk across the KLCC park.

58.review_text: This hotel meet all expectation in terms of services and comfort. They make you feel like a VIP. The hotel is clean and their deco are fantastic. Their food are okay but the are reasonable. However, I do wish their blinds are automated. As it was tedious and noisy pulling the blinds up and down.

59.review_text: Had a lovely staycation at The RuMa Hotel which really was a change of scene for us. We loved the luxurious room which was so comfortable and all the free mini bar  (with coke zero) was a good touch. Dinner at the fine dining Atas restaurant was delicious which rounded off the stay. We found the RuMa a real stress releiever and would love to return!

60.review_text: Celebrated my partner's birthday at the Atas Restaurant over the Christmas weekend. Received an excellent service from the restaurant staff. The team went above and beyond for us. Even helped with the birthday table set up! Food was great too! Had drinks after dinner at the poolside bar with a beautiful view of the KL skyline. Barkeep was very attentive to all our needs. Thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience at Atas Restaurant.   Special thanks to the restaurant manager Wani, Vincent and our captain for the night Khai.

61.review_text: When we arrived 9.30am at the Atas, we were told that we need to wait outside at least 30mins. Yes, stand queuing outside. The Ruma, if you can’t even accommodate such a big crowd of customers, please do not accept all the bookings!

62.review_text: This is definitely one of the best 5 star hotels in KL. It feels homey, cosy and intimate. The rooms are spacious and I love the their bathtub. The staffs are fabulous. I have been to almost all 5 star hotels in KL, and I find that the staffs at the RUMA are the most sincere yet they are very  professional. I had meals at ATAS and SANTAI and the food was fabulous. I didn’t use the gymnasium but the infinity pool is gorgeous. In my opinion, this is the best pool in KL 5 star properties. The hotel is merely 5 mins walk from Pavilion and 10 mins walk from the Petronas Twin Towers. This hotel certainly offers value for money. I’ll be back.

63.review_text: This was my first return stay at the Ruma Hotel after its reopening since the MCO was lifted. Everything remains great and it’s impressive how they keep up to such high quality of service and hotel conditions after the MCO and CMCO.   The Ruma Hotel has also put in notable efforts to safeguard the guests’ safety and well-being by implementing strict protective measures in regard to the virus. I am particularly impressed with the proper disinfection done on all the luggages upon the guests’ arrival at the hotel entrance.  This was my birthday staycation and the hotel has also decorated my room for me, and left me a sweet note with a beautiful cake. Appreciate it.  Overall it’s an enjoyable and awesome experience.  I would also like to extend my gratitude specially to Mr Sebastian…

64.review_text: The hotel feels so much like your own ruma(h). Staffs are welcoming, attentive & friendly. My requests were fulfilled upon being noticed within 24hrs. The rose petals decor & chocs were complementary from the hotel. The chocs were delectable! I stayed in grand king room & the room was very pretty.

65.review_text: Am being very grateful to have a supporting team from RUMA throughout the 6 sessions of our Christmas Gala.. everyone has been really helpful and would give their all in assisting our team to successfully coordinate the event..  My compliments to Alex, Chef Tyson, the amazing fnb crew (Wani, Vincent, Adi, Bell and gang), kak Rozita and all for the support..

66.review_text: Service was unmatched! Literally 7th stay in a year! Love the staff there!! 11 outta ten!!  Got updated to a deluxe suite & a complimentary night! Interiors are worth your instagram profile! Room service menu was also really really good :) recommended all my overseas friends to the hotel!

67.review_text: check in early check out late. this is an awesome convenience for me.  breakfast was excellent tv was not mounted on the centre of the wall from the bed position. for deluxe room only. this is a slight down side.  overall everything is fine

68.review_text: My second visit to RuMa and most of my expectations were met.  Dutiful and friendly staff in what is a swanky and private hotel. A shame I couldn't use most of the facilities but the hospitality and service made-up for it.  Will definitely come back again.

69.review_text: Clean - first to mention! And their hospitality was awesome. Food was great and they were kind enough to provide complimentary birthday deco and cake (of course, the cake was yummy too!). Seamless check in and check out process. Staff were 101% friendly

70.review_text: I was in the hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. I emailed the reservation department right after the booking was confirmed, and the team arranged a piece of cake and did simple decoration in the room, and it was free-of-charge! The room is clean & cozy with luxury touch. Great customer service. Great location. Great choice for staycation. Awesome interior design.   The only thing that the hotel may need to improve perhaps is the water pressure in the bathroom, not really stable though. Other than this, PERFECT!

71.review_text: Prologue Should we forget the right advice to book a corner unit by LIZA? Should we not remember the warm welcome and genuine smile during reception and room introduction by EZAZ? how can we erase the memory of the wonderful decorative touches and mini-gift by SYDNEY? What about that "ayam curry" prepared by my wife & SUHAIMI?  Overview As a couple, we were celebrating the beginning of a new life together.
