Complimentary shuttle service to places around KL also amazing and on time. Special thanks to Gautham and John who felt like family at the end of my trip.  One small niggle was my request for a high floor apartment and despite me checking up daily this was not fulfilled. Was disappointed when new guests to the hotel arrived and were given floor 41 :( and not long term guests ... Hopefully on my next visit i will get a high floor apartment

55.review_text: I booked a one-bedroom apartment; it was huge, modern, super clean, very quiet and the view from both the living room and the bedroom was amazing. Air conditioning and wifi worked well. I appreciated the coffee machine and the laundry facilities inside the apartment. The front desk staff and concierge were friendly, helpful and very service minded. Lanson Place offers excellent value for money. Next time in KL I will stay there again.

56.review_text: Staff made us feel completely comfortable and welcome from the moment we entered the hotel. They all interacted with me.We had a very enjoyable and memorable stay. I'd most definitely stay at this hotel again.

57.review_text: A good location which near night market, Bar and Pavilion. All the staffs at breakfast are helpful, welcoming and friendly, specially Christy. Rooms are spacious which include dinning area, kitchen and washing facilities. We picked 3 bedrooms suite, we had a lot of space for us. Gym facilities are well equipped. Pool located 4th floor is amazing, is standard 50 meter... Cool. We almost spend a half day at there, we did enjoy the moment in Malaysia with local food and different cuisine food. The weather is hot but is fine for us and peoples are very friendly, Lanson Place is my first choice in Kuala Lumpur will be back any time in future.

58.review_text: 3rd time staying at Lanson. Always feel at home in Kuala Lumpur when I stay here Centrally located, but in a quiet section of the city. Amenities within the room are exceptional quality.   Staff are on hand to assist, but not overbearing. Very pleasant and proffessional.

59.review_text: A wonderful getaway stay in Lanson Place. Love the location where it is not far from the city while remains in a quiet neighborhood, away from the hetic traffic CBD. Apartments are spacious and comfortable, perfect settings for families. Cozy breakfast arrangement with an opened view of the city. We will definitely be back!

60.review_text: Hi guys,   at first-what a perfect stay! We are still so happy.   My boyfriend and I left the 2nd. of march to 6. the march in the beautiful Lanson Place Hotel. We had a apartment at the 46. floor. Whoa, that was a view! From our room we could see the big Kuala Lumpur Tower, which filled our hotel room every evening with the light animations. With this view (and that even from our bed in the bedroom) we enjoyed every single second in our room. Bedroom, living room and kitchen are equipped with large windows. A very lightly apartment. What super practical was, that the apartment is not only very big and spacious, but also the apartment is very well equipped. In the room there is a washing machine and a dryer with iron and ironing board (which was very convenient for us, as we are…

61.review_text: I've frequently stayed at Lanson Place over the past 3 years, and I've always enjoyed my stays. The staff are very helpful and the rooms (mini apartments) are large and well-equipped. You can easily stay there for a week or more and feel at home. The location is also very convenient, within walking distance of the older business area of KL city centre, and just a few minutes from the bars and nightlife of Bukit Bintang.

62.review_text: The Residence is absolutely brilliant! The residence manager Mike Chan is very friendly, helpful and sympathetic. We had four days the one bedroom residence and it was very nice! The room is very big and have an amazing view over the city. It is near the KL Tower and the twin towers, a must see! The hotel have a free shuttle service to the KLC (twin towers) that is a plus.  Good free facilities like a big pool, a fully equipped gym and billiard. The breakfast is in the 48th floor with a nice view over the city and very good as well, many variations and you have everything what you need.  I will definitely come back again! I love this place and give 5/5 stars.

63.review_text: we spent over 3 weeks in Malaysia and luckily that we pick this service apartment for my last stop.  The apartment is spacious with full kitchen facilities, washer/dryer etc.  Although it is not located in KLCC, but it is easy assess to city centre.  They did a good job to maintain the common area hygiene, the lounge at roof top is a must to visit.  Highly recommended

64.review_text: I stay at Lanson Place over a week with my family, the apartment is so spacious and spotless, the club house have kids pool and huge pool.  My kids can run around inside the apartment and we cook dinner for few nights.  Staff are always friendly and helpful, the security is 24 hours made me feel very safe.  I will definitely return to Lanson place whenever I back to KL.

65.review_text: Lanson Place never fails to surprise me, this is my 4th stay and still truly is wonderful. For those avid travellers you will agree with me that nothing beats a personalised service especially when you’re away from home. There’s no shortage of that at Lanson Place and in fact that’s what they do best apart from the 5 Star standard of cleanliness. Thank you Lanson team for looking after me as always, see you again soon!

66.review_text: Lanson Place Bukit Ceylon has been home to my project team members and short stay business travellers for over 2 years now. Not only is the location, views, décor and facilities amazing, but above all, management and staff have gone out of their way to make us all feel at home. From hosting surprise birthday, Christmas and special event parties to arranging outdoor gatherings the team has made Lanson Place a home away from home for us team of expats. I would happily recommend Lanson Place Bukit Ceylon to anyone travelling to Kuala Lumpur.

67.review_text: We were upgraded when we checked in (bonus!). Very large suite, super clean. We were on the 26th floor and had a view out to the Sky Tower and Petronas Towers (see photos of view). Wonderful Breakfast selection and it is on the 46th floor with amazing views of the city (don't skip breakfast!!) Very friendly staff! Super comfortable bed!

68.review_text: Clean, love the decor in the room. Breakfast area absolutely breathtaking, and the food served was delicious. Front desk and security are friendly and will not hesitate to lend a helping hand when there is a need.

69.review_text: Great large apartments with massive rooms and views over the city. Very friendly staff, breakfast is ok, nothing special, but you have facilities in your rooms to prepare food. Only negative is the lifts have key cards that only operate the lift to your floor and the bar, so if you have a colleague in another floor, you cant get to their apartment, which was irritating, but not a big deal.

70.review_text: You really are spoilt in terms of amenities and size of apartment, but for me the real icing on the cake was the breakfast room on the top floor. Staff up there were excellent. The only downside is the temperature of the pool, which is enormous. Was somewhat chilly. I would definitely stay here again.

71.review_text: when i book this hotel, I don't expect such nice property due to the rate is not expensive.  When I arrive, the security help me to load the luggage, due to heavy rain, another staff hold the umbrella for me.  The room is spacious and clean, great twin tower view, much better than traditional 5 star hotel, althrough the facilities can't compare, the location is so convenience, many restaurant around within 3 min walk. Staff are so helpful.

72.review_text: Very good location to go eating around bukit bingtang, china town, pavilion and so on. But need more effort for room keeping. I experienced no face towel, hand towel, bath mat and so on. More delta is no drink service at the lounge, you need to pay just a cup of coffee, but plus is good cafe and convenience store at the pool side. Especially coffee and cake at the cafe is excellent!

73.review_text: the hotel is located in residential area, quite but easy access to pavillion and KLCC, walking distance to changkat and Jalan alor where all the bars and restaurants are located. The apartment is clean and spacious, full kitchen facilities, washer and dryer are available in all units.  The roof top breakfast lounge is perfect, the view is stunning, staff are very helpful and cheerful, highly recommended.

74.review_text: I really enjoyed my stay at Lanson Place. Cleanliness is something that I always look out for when I book a place to stay and Lanson Place has been great in that aspect. They had everything I needed. The bed was really comfortable too, I slept really well throughout the night. The location was perfect, it was quiet but also near to the key areas in KL. The service staff were really helpful and polite, checking in and out was fast and easy. I would highly recommend anyone who comes to KL to stay here.

75.review_text: the property is excellent, spacious, spotless, full kitchen facilities, washer & dryer etc. The huge size pool at 5th floor is great, my kids enjoy so much.  Staff are helpful and cheerful...highly recommended

76.review_text: My home when I’m in KL Very nice place and good location All employees focused on customer satisfaction  Room and confort are excellent   The view from 48 th floor is so nice : taking breakfirst  here give you serenity for the day

77.review_text: Modern styled apartment.Cosy and super clean. The staff are very welcoming. From the security guard to reception counter and everyone was super friendly and helpful. The staff are the reason that we would return and recommend this place to others. Full functioning unit with kitchen utensils, cutleries, coffee maker, washing machine, dryer and dishwasher.

78.review_text: the hotel is quite and peaceful, located in residential area but easy access to pavillion, jalan alor and KLCC.  the design is very homey and spacious, apartment is clean, and the view is stunning, many bar and restaurant around, huge pool with cafe, the breakfast is superb.

79.review_text: The appartments are just stunning, clean, and the views are breathtaking. The service of the place is the best you can get and the location is just perfect to enjoy Kuala Lumpur. Everything is walking distance and there are many restaurants and food options nearby the hotel. Fashionistas and shopping addicts will be delighted too, as the most amazing shopping malls are a few minutes away by feet. Breakfast lounge is beautiful and their fitness center is super well equipied with new machines. Would definitely come back if i had to visit KL again.

80.review_text: My family stayed at a two bedroom residence in Lanson Place for three nights in December, 2019 and it was a great choice.  It's centrally located and walking distance to Jalan Alor for wonderful food.  We had a nice view including the Petronas Towers and the two floor lounge at the top of the building was an added bonus.  It has all around views of the city from about 45 stories up so we didn't feel like we had to go to the viewing areas of KL Tower or the Petronas Towers for terrific views of the city.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Highly recommended!

81.review_text: Initially I gave this 3 stars at start of stay.  I’ve now reduced it to 1 star at the end of the stay and wouldn’t stay here again.   It’s a very high rise building. We stayed on floor 43.  It’s a lovely apartment.  However, we never got a good night sleep for the whole duration of our stay.  There was a loud persistently annoying continuous noise all night every night!!    We couldn’t work out where it was coming from.   But it seemed to come from within their own building system (either the vents, air conditioning system or something else).  Based on sleep deprivation I can’t give it more than 1 star.  And therefore would not stay here again.    The cleaning staff were wonderful. You should always tip them daily.  They do a good job and workers should be tipped (in my view).  …

82.review_text: Lanson place always give me the feeling is welcome me back home. The staff always care about you and your feeling and how your stay.  The manager Mike Chan are friendly and welcome me this make me feel like going back my own home stay I will give him 👍🏻

83.review_text: Our family decided to have a return stay in Lanson Place during the recent holidays due to their wonderful hospitality and spacious apartment. With its well-equipped utensils and tools, you can cook in the kitchen anytime. It makes you feel at home.

84.review_text: As usual, whenever I go to KL, I will choose Lanson Place Bukit Ceylon Serviced Residences. Everything you need at home, it's just there. You feel home and you feel small because of its huge space and amenities such as the Pool and Gym. Far from town but I love it because it is away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Food? No problem. Food deliveries are just few buttons away and there nearby restaurants that you could visit too.

85.review_text: Very comfortable stay with great hospitality from the hotel crews. The location is good and very accessible to most places of interest. Definitely will come back again! Special thanks to the resident manager for providing great arrangements to make the stay even more memorable!

86.review_text: We booked a 1 bed apartment through Agoda for 1 night.  There was an enormous amount of space.  A fully equipped kitchen.  Spacious living area with large TV and a spacious bedroom with mountains of storage space.  I've lived in much smaller flats.  The building is slightly showing its age but nothing too much worry about.  The 50 meter pool on the 5th floor was also huge. Very pleasant and stylish lounge area on the top floor complete with iMac computers and a pool table.  All the staff were super polite.  Downsides were the under equipped gym (no rowing machine, only a few light weights), the lifts often take an age to arrive and the a/c was slightly noisy but over all fantastic value especially if you like more space.

87.review_text: althrough the property not located in KLCC, it’s quite and easy access to the city.  cozy lobby and homey apartment design.  The size very spacious, it’s a one bedroom suite but hotel room price, great value.  The staff is nice and welcoming, always prepared to help.

88.review_text: the property localted close to KLCC & Pavillion, walking distance to Jalan Alor the famous local food street.  The aprtment is huge and clean, well maintained.  The view at lounge is stunning and the pool at 5th floor is fantasic.  The staff are always friendly and helpful.  Will definately stay here again when I return to KL.

89.review_text: I would recommend lanson if you are looking for a long stay. All the business centres are quite near. The room is quite spacious and not claustrophobic. Most of the amenities are at par with hotels.The staff goes out of the way to help you out.

90.review_text: Excellent luxurious apartment rooms with first rate facilities and staff and service very helpful with any requests. Recommend this location in KL. Hot water didn't work in one bathroom but fixed promptly. Kids allowed on scooters by pool which isn't great for users. Great for teenagers/parents.

91.review_text: The best place i stayed so far ( regardless of which country ) and the only place i would stay when i travel to KL. The services, location, cleaniness is superb! Suitable for family stay! Never once disappoint me.

92.review_text: Spacious room with good interior design touch with bright color. The hotel is in good location and near to pub street. Convenient store and poolside cafe at level 5. My family had a enjoyable stay overall.

93.review_text: i stayed here one week for my business and leisure trip.  The apartment is spacious, clean and well maintained.  The staff are very helpful, one night I left my phone at Grab car, they helped me to call the driver and return to me within an hour, much appreicated.  Location is close to KLCC & Pavilion, as well as Changkat where all the bars and restaurant are located, I already plan my next trip in Jan.

94.review_text: I was greeted by the friendly security upon arrival, he help me to unload the luggage and direct me to check in.  The lobby is not big but tastefully design, check in staff are friendly and welcoming.  The room is spacious and spotless with twin tower view. Breakfast at lounge is wonderful experience as wells the pool on 5th floor.

95.review_text: I went to this Hotel the first time. I made the reservation by Agoda and they confirmed me as everything were o.k. When I arrive - the first impression - is the lady at the reception. She were not really friendly and I not feel warm welcome. After she take my passport, she ask me to print out my confirmation from Agoda - for what? She had in the system and she also printed out in the customers-folder - I saw. She said: That's important first that I have to give here again. Sorry, after a 5 hours delayed flight and 2 hours driving - I was hungry, tired and dursty - and really not interested to print out (how I can do - open my bags...?) or send by email to her. If is not a other staff at the reception, who is very nice, I change the hotel immediatly. I was very very upset and…

96.review_text: we book 2 bedroom apartment for our family outing, the room is spacious and clean.  Staff are very helpful and friendly, the pool is huge with kids pool as well. Location is close to pavilion and jalan alor.  Highly recommended.

97.review_text: Lanson place has residences that are immediately familiar and comfortable to the resident and has recreational facilities like a pool, gym and bbq areas which brings the homey feeling to life. Definitely recommend, no matter what the duration of the stay would be

98.review_text: stayed here several times. One of my favorite KL stays, very quiet, very comfortable, Good staff. really clean too, Good location (Havana bar is close By). 5* all round.  Il be back again for another stay

99.review_text: Our family needed a nice place in KL for a short holiday. The Lanson Place turned out to be a great decision. The service was excellent and staff name Mr Khai helpful friendly incredibly.  Location wise, Lanson place is located very near the streets of Bukit Bintang and Jln Alor. 5 to 10 mins walk  t the 5th flr, you will find the swimming pool. There were hardly any guest around as this was their soft launch. We had the whole pool to ourselves most of the time. The adult pool is really big and the children pool isnt small either.  Overall we still enjoy our stay in Lanson place!

100.review_text: Top class managed hotel with excellent location at downtown KL. Panoramic view of KL while you having breakfast in the morning. Good for both business and family trip with 50m long pool, functional gym and a play room for young kids. I will definitely come back again.

1.review_text: We got Diplomat Suite and we throw a private birthday party to a friend, everything is perfect, the room is spacious, the service is excellent, we get attention immediately whenever we ask fir it, as well as the stunning room view, we will definitely come back again.

2.review_text: What can I say. I love the hotel, second stay and the service was still as amazing as ever.  The service is what sets this hotel apart and I will not hesitate to arrange our next staycation there.  Special mentions to Raffi (who secured a last minute birthday cake for my wife) from check in and Sulaiman from 38 who really cared for us during our stay and made it more memorable. The staff of the hotel are in general, highly considerate.

3.review_text: The check in process was a bit slow due to large number of customer. However thr staff was kind enough to offer complimentary hi-tea while waiting our room to be ready. Overall, our room was nice and clean. We had a wonderful time. Surely will come again

4.review_text: Please improve your check in process. It took 5 hours before i can get my room key. Even though i had already checked in online. That was a bit of a buzz kill. I had planned a perfect weekend for my wife birthday, turns out to be exhausted from waiting and had to cancelled my saturday evening plans coz we got the keys at 8pm. Everything else was excellent.

5.review_text: Top notch experience of service, dining and hospitality. The great KL view as well from the room. Dining at thirty8KL Restaurant is superb as the ambiance very unbeatable.  Everything is satisfying! hope to have the same service when we return soon.

6.review_text: Book for 3 room with such high room rate 05 star hotel then what u get for...................  *Long queue more than 01 hour to check in exactly like the school canteen style. No refreshment or assist quick check in option and free coffee while waiting without nothing. Such big 05 star hotel only open 01 check in counter during weekend???? Ridiculous 01  *Please do not request for any if you willing to wait Check in at 4pm request for baby cot, baby cot received at 11pm ......... We are too tired for waiting the special baby cot. Request the toothpaste (room do not provide) take times for 03 hours to received. Ridiculous 02  *Dining in restaurant also the same, the waiter just annoying you all the time. Request a drinking water, i go to take it by myself even more faster than…

7.review_text: Had a one night staycation here for honeymoon. Had our dinner at Thirty8 Restaurant. Izhar was our waiter. He's so patient with us, gave us good menu recommendations.. and he has a very lovely voice. Overheard him sang to a few tables for their birthdays. Definitely GH's gem.

8.review_text: We chose stay & dine in package under Grand Gateway Dinner .  The dinner is superb. I can say marketing department grand hayyat so creative & have critical thinking.   The idea of the dinner is super marvellous

9.review_text: I had checked in online early and requested for check in at 2pm. I am supposed to get an email once the room is ready.  It’s now 3.45pm and I have not gotten a single email and I am standing in the line since 3pm with less than 1 metre distance between people in the line! Coke on, Hyatt. You can do better than this. The first person in the line has been there for 30 mins!

10.review_text: We were trying to find an excuse for short break. The themed dinner provided us just that. With 5 star service right from complementary pick up and return, with check in at the room, it was just excellent. We had experienced the Le Petite Chef dinner before. But, this is well worth it. The dinner experience and presentation were much more than expected. The dishes although were good but could be improved. The snow (foam) coming down from the ceiling was fun and not expected. Overall, the experience is well recommended and kudos to Hyatt KL especially to Ms.Anne for her good service helping us from A to Z on this trip.

11.review_text: I enjoyed my stay  at Hyatt due to several reasons. the online check in and easy check out was seamless. the free parking was excellent. and I even managed to squeeze in a morning jog at KLCC park considering that it's merely walking distance from the hotel. staff was very friendly and accommodating as well.

12.review_text: Check-in late due to room unavailabilty but we were comp with grand Hi Tea set while waiting. Breathtaking room view of KLCC on 34th floor. Nice noir vibes bar with good tasty cocktails. Thirty8 Sling & Anchoco would be my favourite poison. Room service was superb. Our champagne didn't go waste. Noon by the pool could only been better if they have cocktail bar by the pool opened. Check-out greeted with wonderful smile and token of appreciation from Front Office Assistant Manager, Ms Nur Sherina and staff. Thank you for making us feel grand!

13.review_text: the staffs were helpful, had our dinner at thirty8 and it was fun. the room was amazing. i love the view where we can take picture from the sky lobby and how the staffs always greet us. please improve on the breakfast..the nasi lemak wasnt as what i expected from hyatt but nasi ayam was great tho..will come back..

14.review_text: Cosy environment, warm & attentive staff and the hotel room is completely isolated from the surrounding noice.  The only thing to take note is the check-in counter is at level 38 instead of the ground floor.  Overall, 5-star experience and will definitely come again.

15.review_text: Excellent customer service from the moment you have made a booking until after your trip. Prompt response and actions from staff members. Literally just walking distance to KLCC twin towers without needing to be under the hot sun at all with all the connecting buildings. Had a great experience here. Definitely will be back again.

16.review_text: Very comfortable bed, clean, great location is just walking distance to KLCC Shopping Centre. Room with complete bathroom facility and excellent ambience. Really great place to stay and very spacious room. Recommended and will come again !

17.review_text: Just had a great staycation over the weekend for my wife birthday celebration. Very well executed SOP in place and still feel welcoming with all the procedures.  Just need to take note that during this time, appointment is needed for the pool access. So please do prepare to book in advance upon check-in. We didn't manage to enjoy the pool facilities as the booking was too overwhelming. Otherwise, its all good. Thanks for the wonderful experience.

18.review_text: Best customer service and hospitality. Delay in check-in process due to room sanitisation process, compensated with extended check out time from 12pm to 4pm. Best Covid-19 SOP. Buffet breakfast served by kitchen servant/chef

19.review_text: Overall it was good place to stay for vacation. The view and room was great and I love the bathtub very much. But the aircond suddenly slow at middle of the night. The cake and food was awesome and delicious.

20.review_text: very nice place for staycation, food all very nice. highly recommended. staff very friendly and helpful room very clean. good place to bring with family, very comfortable and clean.bathroom with bathtub was superb

21.review_text: Had to check-in late but the hotel was kind enough to allow us late check-out. Had an awesome service at Thirty8 with the singing waiter (i.e. Izhar) did an amazing job entertaining us with his congratulatory song rendition of ‘Someone Like You’ by Adele. Definitely will come again for their accommodating service

22.review_text: Everything was perfect, except long que during check in process.  The deluxe room was magnificent! Breakfast spread was awesome! Will definitely come again. Thanks Grand Hyatt for your awesome hospitaliy.

23.review_text: Overall we are very happy and have enjoyable experiences and funs dining with both the Grand Getaway & Le Petite dinner arrangement by Grand Hyatt KL event team and management. Keep up the good works and these special theme dinners. Thanks

24.review_text: Close to KLCC and have a lovely restaurant at Thirty38 - we had breakfast there and the view was amazing, and the morning crowd was managed well with proper social distancing even though it was supposed to be busy. Tips, do arrive early for breakfast during weekends. Everything felt safe during this Covid situation. Room was spacious and cosy, loved the rain shower and bath tub, and the entire bathroom. Close proximity to KLCC and a walk near the park.

25.review_text: Pleasent stay, nice ambience, the thirty8 staff irwan was very nice, i will like to stay again soon. The check in process also dont take long, the staff there also was very helpfull, overall was very awesome

26.review_text: everything was excellent , with great services, room and facilities . if you can improve your gym facilities it would be much better. dining and breakfast was tasty , everything was excellent not much to comment on

27.review_text: Grand Hyatt have everything that I need all in one place. Magnificent KL skyline view. Great tasty food and drinks. Friendly hotel staffs. Clean and spacious ambience. The design with the bathroom at the back of the king size bed was totally unexpected. With a switch, the glass can be clear or frosted.

28.review_text: Everything is good and hotel is clean ,good view,good location,nice food,nice environment,good experience,good service,good price,clean,hotel staff is polite and nicely,fast check in,free parking is good for hotel guest

29.review_text: The deluxe room with the tower view was breathtaking and the food was amazing both fine dining and breakfast. Definitely will come back for other occasion or just for a short break after a long tiring work

30.review_text: Hotel is clean. Greeted with good services. Not to mention the location is at the centre of KL. Room service was great. Definitely will recommend their room service. Food was great and worth every penny

31.review_text: Room & breakfast is superb. Awesome view! KLCC is just in front of our view. They even send me complimentary anniversary cake to my room. Me & my husband appreciate it so much! It is highly recommended!

32.review_text: Compared to my stay at Mandarin Oriental on the day before, I feel the staff in Grand Hyatt are so much less friendly and very judgmental. I really feel the hotel is overrated and more of like for business travelers. I don’t think the hotel vibes suits those who are looking for a relax and chill staycation in the city. The access to klcc park is quite a distance. The TV in the room not strategically located - how can someone work in peace when you have the TV above your head & definitely the other guest won’t be able to enjoy watching TV. I have to wait for few mins for the staff to pick up the phone when i called the guest service line. Had my lunch at JP Teres at 2.30pm - very small crowd, but then it took 20mins for the “ready made” chicken rice to be served. And we even have…

33.review_text: The hotel is located in a very good location near to malls (walking distance). The room has good soundproofing and comfortable. We got the room with the view not facing KL Tower/Twin Tower but still great.  The bed is comfortable and clean facing the view. I personally like the how the bathroom is designed/positioned. The bath tub & rain shower is separated from the toilet bowl and the basin, just at the overhead of the bed (comes with privacy glass function). Rain shower water is not bad (shower head could better), marbled bath tub is just nice. There's a small walk in wardrobe which is kinda cool, big enough to store luggages and your clothes to hang in. Breakfast buffet spread is just average a little less choices I would say. We ordered room service which is good and not too…

34.review_text: As a first time guest at Grand Hyatt, my family and I were extremely pleased with the premises, the service and the care shown to us. We had a staycation here on account of my husband's 40th birthday. Even with our children aged 10, 5 and 2 years old, not once did we feel as though they weren't welcome (as some other hotels we have experienced). Instead, they made us feel more than welcome and provided excellent customer service - above and beyond what was expected. 5 stars and definitely recommend staying at Grand Hyatt.

35.review_text: Great property with a great coffee house serving excellent local fare. Food for breakfast and 38 can be better nonetheless the views from that floor is always amazing. SOP protocol properly executed, staff was pleasant thruout our stay. Room condition is well maintained- would have liked it better it there was more current streaming program available, eg Netflix

36.review_text: We were offered early check in and received complimentary chocolate cake which was soooo tasty. Check in and check out process were very smooth. Staffs are very accommodating and polite. Swimming pool is open with 1hour time slot, make sure to book your spot early. Gym is on walk-in basis limited to only 6 persons at a time. Breakfast spread is delicious. Nice staycation despite cmco.

37.review_text: The best hotel for your staycation in the heart of the city. The services are extremely PREMIUM and the food was DIVINE. We will definitely come back for longer stay so that we can enjoy the city more

38.review_text: Hyatt staff guided us from level 38 all the way to G floor because we said we wanted cakes. Decorated our cake because we said it was our anniversary, it was a wonderful surprise. Overall nice room, staffs are friendly and attentive. Will stay again next time.

39.review_text: The room , food and views are great. Have an enjoyable stay with my family and birthday celebration at Grand Hyatt Hotel. I love the shoutout  requested by my wife and prepared by Hotel. Looking forward for a second visit soonest

40.review_text: was looking for a nice cosy place for our honeymoon in the town and hyatt was just perfect. the room and service was great and it is a walking distance to KLCC and a drive away to other attractive places in KL.

41.review_text: Very poor bed. The room is old but it is understood certain things can't b improved for an old property. But the bed is really low quality. For something movable would have expected management to be able to update their beds. 2 star hotel bed. The rest was good.  Breakfast taste wise normal. I think 3 star is more well suited for this hotel. But location wise 5 star. That's about it which is 5 star

42.review_text: Stayed for 3d2n with kids. The place is amazing with view of twins tower and city view at night. We enjoyed our staycation. My suggestion is if you are staying in the room that have a twins tower view please order a room dining for dinner instead of having it at thirty8 floor (worth the value of money) :-)

43.review_text: Great staff, lovely amenities, lovely sleep, yummy breakfast buffet with good safety... And even 2 birthday cakes cause I accidentally dropped one! What more can I ask for?  Only downside was bad TV connection when the rain happened.  Highly recommend this place for a birthday staycation!

44.review_text: I've been dreaming of spending my weekend in Grand Hyatt KL for as long as forever! Am so glad that everything went smoothly, and the hospitality provided make us do not want to leave. We enjoyed our delicious 4 course dinner served by Izhar..he even sang a beautiful song as he served our anniversary cake..the ambience, the friendly staff have made us feel less awkward being first time dining in at such an exquisite place. The breakfast is out of this world..the bedroom, the pool..i don't think one night stay will ever be enough! I'll definitely come back for a longgg weekend next time ❤️❤️❤️

45.review_text: stayed for only one night. the room is functional and practical, it is also much bigger than I expected. took the room with the tower view and it is totally worth it. staff were helpful and courteous. breakfast was awesome with plenty of choice.

46.review_text: Enjoyed every second of our honeymoon there. The breakfast menu was amazing. The room was very clean and neat. The elevator was fast which i really love! Checkin process was fast and pleasant. The reception girl explain everything thoroughly to us regarding the deposit. Would recommend it!

47.review_text: Absolutely was a pleasant birthday staycation. Didn’t expect there will be a birthday cake in the room. The kind of gesture made us feel touched and appreciated. The room is neat and the bedsheets are clean. Breakfast at Thirty8 with KLCC view is definitely worth to experience.

48.review_text: Booked the stay through Go Grand Getaway and all requirements such as early check, surprise decoration from third party, changing menu as we don’t consume lamb etc etc was taken care off. They were fast in responding to your emails to ease your doubt.  On a side note, the room was clean, well maintained and the food was really good. Would definitely come back again!

49.review_text: Great hospitality, the staff was very friendly....the room was very spacious with great ambiance..delicious dine in menus...memorable stay and for sure will come back later for next vacation or business trip...

50.review_text: Good: Excellent service by its staff, a variety of breakfast buffet despite movement control order, vibrant yet serene ambience, great location - within KLCC and Bukit Bintang vicinity, comfortable rooms, nice view especially @ Thirty8.  Needs improvement: Quality of beds  - it should be more comfy and fluffy for better good night sleep, switches in the room are scattered - they (especially switches for common spaces) should be placed at a centralised location.  Overall: recommendable and still worth your money. In term of pricing, it is affordable.

51.review_text: Stayed in Grand Tower View Suite.   Negatives   1. Staff members handling reservations don't seem to know the amenities in the rooms very well. So guests come in expecting A, but receive anything but. Embarassing that they give customers wrong information during the reservation process. 2. Staff members don't seem to know their own policies during the pandemic - we were told we could get Grabfood or Foodpanda to deliver and the staff could send the food to our room, but when I did that the first night I was there, I got a "oh we will get back to you on whether it's possible" over the phone after I had already placed the order. But thankfully there weren't any issues.  3. The buffet beakfast at Thirty8 is just okay.  4. Price of food at Thirty8 is unjustifiable. The food is…

52.review_text: If got snacks in the room, better don’t eat it.. later it charge rm10 for each snack..as my expectation, 5 star hotel it should not take any advantage to customer since currently mco and we can’t go out for late night to find food nearby since all the shop closed.

53.review_text: Room is clean and nice.. staff are friendly.. foods are super delicious. Love the in room service food.. and also their breakfast.. it just because of covid that the overall food experience a bit limited due to contactless service. Overall are great:

54.review_text: Me and my husband celebrated our anniversary and my birthday in Grand Hyatt. The experience is better than expected. The dinner was great and the staff was superb, especially Mr Izhar. Sang a song for my birthday, absolutely a friendly person.

55.review_text: · I've requested for complimentary cake for my anniversary and they agreed to served the welcome cake upon my check in day however, they failed they gave me upon my checkout day on the next day. I'm so so disappointed I've booked the room is towers view room and it's not cheap anyway. At first, they already emailed and agreed for welcome cake but they forgot I guess which I don't know what happened actually. During my stayed I've also requested to have sanitary pad since i'm suddenly in hotel having heavy flow period pain on the night, I've called guest service button but your staff -guest service staff said they don't have, they have to find it, how could the 5 star hotel don't even provide any sanitary pad? or could even spare the sanitary pad for customer who is in emergency…

56.review_text: location is superb. good for my business trip.  But not as expected like other 5 stars hotel.  For me personally the experience is below my expectation. Also during breakfast some chefs were very impatient but not all of them. Room cleaner did not refill up some necessity.

57.review_text: We chose Grand Hyatt (GH) hotel for our stay. We stayed there for a few days. It was such an amazing and relaxing experience. The room was beautiful and has an overview of the city. The service provided was amazing! The food for dine in was absolutely delicious. The breakfast is hearty, healthy and has plenty of choices. Overall, its like you walk into another world of hospitality.

58.review_text: It was a majestic view waking up to Twin Tower KLCC view! The breakfast was superb and luxurious. Recommended for Anniversary celebration! The first thing you will be seeing is the sky lobby view upon checkin, it was picturesque!

59.review_text: I get a complimentary dinner voucher and small birthday cake for my wife birthday. Overall is very good.  Staff really helpful starting from check in until checkout. Best experience if youre in honeymoon and would prefer to choose klcc view

60.review_text: Hubs and i celebrated my birthday at 38 restaurant. Very pleasant group of staff. Good food, service excellent! Was serenade with a bday song by Izhar one of the staff, he has a lovely voice! Full recommendation to celebrate your special day here. Magnificent view of the twin towers.

61.review_text: Room were very spacious and clean. Had good food especially breakfast. Staff service were superb. It is a bit confusing if you are not familiar with the place. Check in is at upper floor. Plenty of parking space available at basement.

62.review_text: We love chilling in the room and enjoying the stunning twin towers view day n night! Room service was excellent, we love the food too. Customer service was much over my expectations, we especially like the extended check-out time for 2 times of our staycation. Thumb up for their hospitality :)

63.review_text: If you are traveling with friends or family, this hotel is not suitable since it has zero privacy in room. Poor guest service at thirty8 during breakfast and not much of breakfast choices. They cut cost in many ways, disappointing stay, Dusty room most probably because of been awhile since guests stayed since lock down imposed.

64.review_text: Bed was big and comfortable. The bathtub was awesome, overlooking the twin towers. Though facilities are closed during MCO, I had a great time spending in the room itself. In room dining was good. Recommend the chicken rice and lamb thala set. Overall had a great stay.

65.review_text: I choose this hotel since it is at the middle between KLCC and Pavilion, so I get to visit both during my stay while my husband look after my kids. The bath room is top notch with all marble tiles and massive bath tub which my kids really enjoy since the pool is not open due to MCO. Will definitely come back again

66.review_text: Room Superb.. Overall Superb.. Breakfast super on time, excellent.. Service excellent.. Room cleanliness superb.. Covid19 awareness excellent.. Customer service response very quickly.. Nice panorama..

67.review_text: Its been a while since me and my husband went on a holiday so we decided to extend another night in Hyatt after Valentine's. Love the hotel so much. The food was great & staff were really friendly & extremely helpful. Will definitely book Hyatt again in the future.

68.review_text: The breakfast is superb! Many options and I feel so warmed and delighted with the customer services throughout my stay. Felt so surprised with the free chocolate cake and flowers prepared by Grand Hyatt as they knew it was a stay to celebrate my anniversary with my spouse.

69.review_text: Very impressed with the attention provided by the excellent staff. From the time we entered the hotel right up to check out every single staff provided a very warm and welcoming feeling. The room set up was great and the breakfast selection was top notch with fast and very friendly service

70.review_text: Recommended to everyone, especially couples... room is good, bathroom and toilet are clean, view is great, service is good... looking forward for next stay too... fulfilled the special occasion for couples birthday celebration during covid period...

71.review_text: Dear Hotel Manager and General Manager of Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur, I am surprisingly overwhelmed by the professional service of Anu (Lobby Manager) and Jolene (Grand Lounge Receptionist). They truly deserve a promotion. I stayed in Room 2906 on Valentines Day and we had one of the best views in the world facing the KLCC Twin Towers. Anu did the impossible and made a miracle happen in which he got us a last minute slot at Restaurant 38 for Valentines Day Dinner. I called every single Hotel in Kuala Lumpur and all they could say was fully booked with no intention of helping out at all. Anu is a man who truly cares for his guests. I salute you, Anu. I am looking forward to your promotion soon. Jolene on the other hand is by far the best Hotel Receptionist I have ever met in Kuala…

72.review_text: I and my wife booked for 1 night stay at Grand Hyatt Delux Tower King View room during MCO2.0 to celebrate her birthday, we have been informed that our room  upgraded to Grand Suite upon check in. This is really a surprise for my wife as she never stay in 5 stars hotel Grand Suite room, plus that is her birthday. It is so amazing and we are really enjoy our night staying in a room with 1130 ft2 having a separate bathtub facing Petronas Twin Tower. Although we missed the breakfast buffet at hotel Cafe but we have been served in room breakfast and it creates a romantic customer experience during MCO2.0. Really appreciated Grand Hyatt Hotel arrangements during MCO2. 0 as we have been offered a luxury experience without additional costs.

73.review_text: Great welcomed by Hyatt Team. Hotel did a good follow up and reply via email till the day i checked in as i celebrate my wife birthday. Complimentary Chocolate cake was arranged. Feel very warm. Breakfast was freshly served to the room. Early check in and late check out was arranged by the hotel team. Appreciate that so much! Thanks Hyatt.

74.review_text: This was my first hotel stay at the heart of the City having lived around the City and a special occasion on my birthday! I enjoyed really the ambience facing the high rise buildings surrounding the hotel in particular the Petronas twin towers and KL Tower The room service was really superb and we enjoyed having our breakfast inside the suite because of the SOP during lockdown We will definitely come again in the future!

75.review_text: Good stay although the pandemic kept the hotel vacant. Staff provided personalized service. The room amenities were adequate and the location was perfect, next to KLCC park. We had our breakfast in bed.

76.review_text: Had to getout to boost my mental health. Hotel is less than 7km aways from my home. It was our first anninersary with our newborn. Watching the magnificient Twin Towers, like a giant HD moving picture on the wall. We had a great time just being in the room with room service. It was just what we needed. Thanks for the special arrangement from hotel management. Toiletries for my baby. And the cake for us. Stay safe everyone.

77.review_text: Amazing room, great views, average food for a 5 star hotel, good service & personal,....towels are rough, no newspaper or any reading material is sad, curtains can't close completely, hancur glaring in the bedroom, pic illustration on the food menu can help during covid times

78.review_text: Love the room, really spacious, impressive layout, love the bathroom concept, view is gorgeous as we face the Twin Tower, great customer service and room service! Bed is big and super comfy. My family really enjoyed ourselves there. The breakfast restaurant had impressive view!

79.review_text: My stay in Grand Hyatt KL was amazing. The room is spacious and top notch. The size of the room is bigger compared to other 5 stars hotel in Kuala Lumpur. Customer experience is great. Ambiance of the surrounding is so good.

80.review_text: hotel location very strategic near klcc. hotel clean. However, breakfast is not up to the quality (not much selection, food does not taste good). swimming pool clean. room just nice. view from the hotel great

81.review_text: Will repeat!we love the fact that the staffs are helpful since we bring along our kids so we were always using strollers. The breakfast experience with the KLCC background will definitely be our sweetest memory during our stay there. Can't wait for covid to be over and visit hyatt again

82.review_text: Expected of 5star hotel. All staff is very helpful. The only thing I had difficulties is when finding the lift to the rooms. No signage of the lift I had to circle around the place 2x. And not just me. Another guest also is confused like us too

83.review_text: Wasn't our first stay at Grand Hyatt. We were there recently to celebrate my son's birthday. Our stay package includes dinner at Le Petit Chef. Both restaurant and hotel are awesome. Grand Suite is awesome. Breakfast buffet was great. And my kids love the swimming pool so much (1hr allocated for each room is never enough but have to adhere to the rule due to covid)  Overall, we enjoy our stay at Grand Hyatt. And million thanks for the complimentary birthday cake & chocolates for my son. He loves the surprise. Will definitely come back again and again and again 😉

84.review_text: I love everything about grand hyatt, the room, cleanliness, food.... owh lord the food..... and the staff who are always accommodative to ur request! They are friendly, very responsive, and would accommodate to ur request..

85.review_text: Overall, I enjoyed my stay, the bed was cozy. Having our  breakfast at the restaurant 38 was a pretty cool experience, overlooking the Twin Towers. Staff were all friendly and helpful. The only thing that could be improved on is the wait time to check in. It was unusually long.

86.review_text: Its a place for total relaxation including business meetings.  I have stayed in may 5 stars accommodation internationally and Grand Hyatt Kl must stand out tall amongst its competitors.   The staff are well trained with such friendliness and no compromise that ultimately provides an ambience of warm welcome to the discerning guests.  I will definitely recommend whether for business or pleasure to the Grand Hyatt KL Malaysia.  Keep up the good work and  Hyatt's position in the premium market is into a big run in the foreseeable future

87.review_text: Our first time at the Grand Hyatt KL and surely not our last. Elegant marble finishings, awesome round bathtub and friendly staff. Room was big, nice and clean. Definitely will come again with the kids 😁

88.review_text: Was extremely disappointed with the lack of compassion to the fact that I came to spend my honeymoon at this hotel without being offered even the most basic complementary gestures like rose petals in my room. Every time I asked can u please upgrade my room, or the very least give me a high room with a nice view everything had to charged. Most hotels I have stayed in over the course of my life whenever it was for a special occasion I was always offered an upgrade. Also for the extravagant price I was charged u will think the internet will be excellent unfortunately it was total crap. Anyway please stay away from this hotel if u plan to celebrate your honeymoon or special occasion.

89.review_text: Highly recommend the Grand Hyatt for a staycation to others in KL. Great views, amazing breakfast and super comfortable rooms. We especially enjoyed the happy hour at Bar 38 and the snacks that they had for the happy hour too. Staff is super friendly and accommodating. Thank you Grand Hyatt!

90.review_text: I hv been longing to have a short vacation after years of handling kids(my kids) and that almost ripped me off my sanity. Plus the recent cov19 case, we were trapped at home for God knows how long. Luckily we managed to find time and spent 2 nights at Grand Hyatt KL. And we're so glad we chose GHKL because it was a such a wonderful experience. We will definitely go again (but because we are not the t20, we need to do some budgetting and savings first! Haha)

91.review_text: Room was spacious. Luxurious amenities. My kids enjoyed the staycation very much. Breakfast was superb with fantastic view. Cleanliness is observed, and hygiene was well taken care of. I felt safe with the well thought of hygienic care.

92.review_text: Food was bad and things promised were not provided especially coming from an established hotel. Paid so much for the Le Petite dinner but the food quality was bad added only with a very basic breakfast food. Promise with a room with KLCC view but got a view with old hotels instead.

93.review_text: We wanted to go for a staycation for the year end and we were looking for a hotel which still serves breakfast buffet. Grand Hyatt kept a very good SOP since the moment you check in. We checked in just before 3 and the whole process was quick and easy. The room is clean and neat although we initially had issues with the TV which keep turning off out of nowhere. We had to call in a technician to fix it.   The breakfast buffet at Thirty8 was marvelous. Make sure to go early if you want a good spot. We went down just before 8am and manage to get the tower view. The place also get a bit packed around after 9. The buffet station is covered with a transparent wall so you can choose the food and ask one of the cooks to serve you. They also have waiters to send over hot beverages to…

94.review_text: Wonderful experience and excellent customer service makes it exquisite hospitality. It's good for those who are looking for business stay, family, or even a short vacation for couple. I will come back here again.

95.review_text: Upon arrival the check-in was smooth. Really excited and amazed upon entering the room because we booked for King bed room with KLCC Twin Tower view and we were given room at 33rd floor which has beautiful view of twin tower and KLCC. We take HydeOut dinner package which has dinner buffet and activity for my two kids to keep them busy with fun activities while enjoying the dinner. After that just enjoying the whole night on comfortable bed facing the KLCC Twin Tower. Breakfast in the morning a little pack because all the guest preferred to have breakfast at Thirty8 (level 38) restaurant compare to another available restaurant at ground floor. We manage to get a table at level 38 after waiting about 15-20minutes. Breakfast choices was plenty for both adult and kids with choices…

96.review_text: Le petit chef is the best led meal I have ever eaten. It is designed with great care and I like every dish.  The little chef is exquisite,really Awesome 👍🏻. Great shows and nice experience and delicious food .

97.review_text: The hotel is awesome. Breakfast is delicious with variety choices of food. The gym is also very conducive for exercise. The room is very spacious and well organize. Check in & check out staff is very helpfull.

98.review_text: Stayed for 3D-2N with my small family (including a 3-year old), both for business and staycation, and while there were some minor negatives (such as the cleanliness of the minifridge and its rigid design which did not allow much flexibility to store containers/things, and the awkward location of some of the lighting switches), I must say overall it was a great experience as the hotel was very impressive in all other aspects. The room was comfortable, clean, well equipped (superb working area), very quiet, and has a beautiful view of the city. The service level was commendable - all staff were friendly, efficient and very accommodating - and the hotel took a lot of initiative to ensure COVID-19 preventive measures were firmly in place.   Besides an underwhelming dinner at the…

99.review_text: Enjoy your stay here with the accomodations provided along with world class staffs and a view worth dying for. Do take your time to a two night stay because I would say it's even better. Trust me, it's worth it.

100.review_text: Breakfast was excellent,I like the SOP imposed on pool usage,making it uncrowded for guests to swim comfortably. Would consider staying there again in future, hopefully to check out bigger rooms. Perhaps check-in part can be improved though.

The Majestic Hotel Kuala Lumpur.address: No 5, Jalan Sultan Hishamuddin, Kuala Lumpur 50000 Malaysia

1.review_text: We took advantage of the weekday promotion with breakfast and stayed for 4 nights. The breakfast was great but due to the Covid Pandemic, it has to be staggered to avoid overcrowding. The breakfast is great and with ample selection. Since only 2 time slots allocated, the wait time for breakfast can be a bit long. Maybe if there are 4 time slots of 1 hour each may help to cut down peak waiting time. The room was clean, comfortable and safe. The staff were great, very helpful, responsive and courteous. There were minor housekeeping issues but was speedily resolved by Duty Manager (Encik Hasli) and Housekeeping Manager (Puan Adi). The pool is nice too. Location is great, near to many tourist attractions and public transportation hub. For those who enjoy morning or evening walks/jogs, there is a nice Lake Gardens nearby. Parking is a flat rate of RM15 per day but need to be careful since sometimes it charges 2 per day which happened to us twice. Nevertheless, we truly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return here for future staycation. …

2.review_text: The hotel is very nice. We got ourselves the Junior Suite. The room is big and comfy. Fancy toilet with bathtub and tv.  The people are friendly. They hospitality is 5 star but the check in process is 0 star rating.  However, the poor check in procedure is a major let down. I was in the queue for 2 hours since my requested checkin time at 4 PM (manage to get myself registered at only at 6PM), just to learn my room is not ready for the next 2 hours.  I was compensated with dinner voucher. The front desk guy was very patient with a hot tempered guy like me. I am sorry for him.  More about the room  Junior Suite with King Bed  Cons 1.The couch is stained and there are some corners of furnitures are dusty. 2. TV is too small to enjoy from the bed. 3. No snacks or fruits provided 4. Some of the light switches is upside down. And no switch board available at the sides of the bed. 5. Drinkinh water need to be requested  Pros 1. Large room 2. Comfortable bed and pillows 3. Large bathroom with bathtub 4. Hot water available 24/7 5. Nice coffee maker 6. 2 working tables enable two of us to work at a time 7. Large window with view of old buildings  This place is good for a staycation with easy access (I'm driving) to anywhere in KL.   Overall I would rate at 4 out of 5 stars.…

3.review_text: I initially booked with their sister hotel (Hotel Stripes) but was relocated to Majestic Hotel as Hotel Stripes remain closed despite that they accepted the booking. The e mail informing me of the relocation was rather last minute 1.5 days prior to departure. Needless to say this little incident was rather unsatisfactory as we made plans around Hotel Stripes (restaurant bookings within the vicinity that is walking distance) and being left in the limbo at the eleventh hour.   However Natasha Kok from Majestic's reservation did an excellent job in pacifying me and sorted out the room confirmation and ensuring that i was provided with the room and dining privileges on par with what i booked with Hotel Stripes. In fact, i would like to commend that she went above and beyond and exceeded expectations entirely in ensuring customer satisfaction. This happened to be my third stay with Majestic Hotel and it is their impeccable and exemplary services such as this that they will always have in my books as one of my recommended choice of Hotel for KL. Rest assured that you have my loyalty and return patronage.  Hotel rooms are clean and tastefully furnished although some deep cleaning and minor touch up should serve the hotel well since it has been operational for many years. Buffet breakfast has a smaller spread compared to pre covid times but it is adequate.  Doorman to front desk service were top notched as always. My compliments to the Majestic Hotel team.…

4.review_text: Not sure how to feel about the RM70 nasi goreng. was hoping for a better presentation /taste if im paying that much. The chicken i swear is preheat kfc chicken and the nasi goreng is from across the street. so better Majestic

5.review_text: The ambience and hospitality was delightful, we had a small issue with the junior suite as the door handle made it difficult to lock but the management was accommodating and offered us the grand suite, the bath tub was big and it had a tv in the bathroom, bed and pillows were so comfy, location was strategic, spa was so relaxing and worth it. Thank you Majestic KL. Till we meet again 😊

6.review_text: On 5th March, we have enquired about organising a birthday celebration at the Colonial Cafe in Majestic Hotel on 13th March. Upon receiving their high tea menu, and taking into consideration that it includes the following items in the menu: Mille Feuille, Basque Burnt Cheesecake, Opera Cake, Florentine and Salted Caramel Eclair, we have decided to proceed with the plan and made a booking to have the high tea menu.  On 13th March, instead of being served as per the menu, we were served an assorted type of cakes and instead of receiving 5 different types of desserts, we have only received 4 types of assorted cakes and when we enquired about the type of cakes, it took numerous waiters to come by our table before they could provide an explanation on the type of cakes we were having…

7.review_text: 1. February and March 2021 has been very hot, and that calls for a staycation. My stay was upgraded to The Majestic KL as The Stripes remains closed.  2. Check-in took a little long. People took advantage to have a staycation since 6-7 March was the first weekend since MCO was lifted. The reception was fully staffed.  3. I was given a corner room. The room was very comfortable, and the bathroom was fantastic. I loved the standalone tub. However, not all amenities were provided. I had to call Housekeeping for face towels. The shampoo & bath gel still contain methylparaben.  4. That being said, the room was showing its age. A portion of the wallpaper had peeled off, and one of the mirror lights malfunctioned. The plastic portion of the lampshades are cracked, but it didn’t render…

8.review_text: 5stars hotel room which come with a big bathtub and tv in bathroom. Love the deluxe king room, but too bad can’t post the room video here. The breakfast selection is not many, but the quality is 👍 and have nice decoration. Although nothing special on the swimming pool and roof garden, but the 5stars room definitely worth for the visit!

9.review_text: CHECK IN: smooth & fast. from parking you need to change lift to go to the room. so need to pass by the reception.  ROOM: i requested for high floor room & facing city/ monorail. room are so spacious. seriously you wont regret it. i booked junior suite. from outside look like old white building but interior inside was superb. modern n classy. love the bed. love the sofa bed. got dining table.so many chairs inside the room. also got coffee machine inside the room (extra point). i love the bathtub. u can watch tv while bathing. i love everything about the room. this is 1 of my favourite hOtel to stay in KL👍  FACILITIES: didnt have a chance to see around as staying in the room is better during covid. in january the pool still open n limited for 5pax if i'm not mistaken. u can book…

10.review_text: Our room was huge, with a study/work table, dining table, dressing table, sofa and daybed!  Superb value for the price paid.  We had our meals at the hotel.  The breakfast buffet spread at Contango, and lunch/dinner menu at Colonial Cafe were limited but sufficient nonetheless for us.  The only grouse we had was the long wait to check in.  We arrived at 3pm on a Saturday and only got our room at 8pm (seemed as though the whole of Klang Valley was also there for a staycation that weekend).  Staff said they would call when our room was ready but they never did.  They were not even apologetic about the unusually long wait.

11.review_text: We stayed at the junior suite. It was really nice and spacious. Can’t fault anything, everything was lovely. Staff were courteous and helpful at all time. Everything went super well, just like our previous stay. Until, the time we wanted to book the pool. Understandable that we need to follow the SOP during this RMCO. But the management should be wary of some KIASU guests who just simply book slots but didn’t bother to turn up hence denying other guests opportunities to enjoy the pool. And given the limited space, why can’t the management allow those staying at the new wing to use the always empty pool in front of the spa. Afterall we are all paid guests under the same hotel. Why just want to reserve that pool for few guests who apparently don’t want to use it? Then came…

12.review_text: I went on 3rd to 5th January 2021. When i called prior booking, i was informed that the swimming pool is open. But when i came, only 4 people at a time for 1 hour slot. It was hard to get the slot. Also the pool depth is 1.2m which is not children-friendly. Not advisable to go if you have small kids.   Breakfast buffet is not available until further notice. I stayed for 2 nights and i was charged rm14x3 days parking. When i asked the front counter staff, she said all other hotels also charge for parking.   Otherwise, the foreigner male housekeeping staff at level 8 did good job in cleaning my room. He was thorough in cleaning.

13.review_text: This is our second time staying at The Majestic. We came back because the service was always excellent and also the rooms are spacious. Due to covid, the buffet breakfast selection is not as excellent as it was last year. But the service is excellent as always. The only downside was that they forgot inform us that we need to validate our parking daily. We stayed for 3 days and had to pay for 2 days parking due to this as we only stayed at the hotel and didn’t went out.

14.review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3D2N stay at this luxurious, colonial YTL hotel. We love its proximity to the Botanical Gardens – easy access to lush, greenery despite being in busy, busy KL.  Our room was spacious and grand from all points. We were especially impressed by the bathroom – with beautiful black marble flooring and a lavish bath-tub set in the middle facing the TV.   Our stay had breakfast included. On Sunday it was buffet breakfast with quite a wide selection of choices. On Monday it was ala-carte . But portions were big. We made friends with Chef Zaidi. His nasi lemak with rendang chicken is a must-try. The hotel has a beautiful Orchid Conservatory where we could have had afternoon tea but we did not book in advance. Sigh.  Another time perhaps. Due to MCO we opted not…

15.review_text: We stayed at The Majestic on the last week of Dec 2020, between Christmas & New Year. Despite being a weekday, the hotel was almost fully booked, which is great to see for business, especially during these trying times.  The check in process was smooth, although long queue. Front desk employee Phoebe (i think) was nice & accommodating. It was a pleasant experience.  The room was nice & beautifully decorated, although starting to show signs of aging. Room 511 has some floor tiles in the bathroom which are broken, but thats not really a big deal. In general, we were happy with the condition of the room. The beds & pillows were comfy and provided us with sound sleep, which is great.  Being a colonial hotel, the place (especially the Majestic Wing) has lots & lots of photo-opp…

16.review_text: -Very smooth and fast check in/out on weekday. Less than 5 min. -Swimming pool need to book because only 3 people per pool per hour. -Afternoon tea only available on weekend. The Orchid room only available on weekend. Quite disappointed for cant try the high-tea.  -Big, spacious and room. Love the bathtub.  -Very near ( walking distant ) to KTM.  -Looking forward to come back to stay and try out the afternoon tea at the orchid room - Very good SOP, all the staff wear mask and never take down or put on the chin.

17.review_text: Stayed two nights. Travelling with one child. Sofa already in the room. For the hotel to provide bed sheet, blanket and pillow, charge us RM165.00 per night!!!! A real rip off😡 No towels in the room when we checked in. Pillows were too soft. Mini fridge not cold at all. Breakfast had a long queue for the food, quality was ok only. As a guest you have to pay for parking- RM14 per day😱  Other room facilities were fine, clean and comfortable. Pool was nice and warm.

18.review_text: I was soo looking forward to stay in Majestic since forever, and I was able to do it today since they got pretty good offer. However, I have been experiencing dissapointing experience from the start. The check in was so bad that I had to wait in Q for almost an hour, and come on, not even a welcome (or apology) drink or something?   After came in the room, we were welcomed by an annoying humming sound came in from somewhere that I had to call downstairs to check it out, turn out something related to their piping issue. Only 1 towel and no floor mat in the room, again need to call them to send it in.   We came straight from Johor Bahru and was starving and we decided to try their in-room dining service since its Majestic right? Oh my God, it was the worst decision ever! Not only…

19.review_text: I am a Platinum Elite Marriott Bonvoy member and I was asked to join the queue which is very long. Very disappointing experience. Waited for 30 minutes and still waiting. I’ve asked two staff at the check in counter and I was told the same thing. No special check in for Platinum Elite members and have to join to queue.  I don’t understand the hotel management rationale for this. They might as well don’t join Marriott group.

20.review_text: Look like no improvement by the team. When I try to show my BonVoy status, the reply is “Just Que Up”. No privileges treatment given. First time such treatment under BonVoy, perhaps BonVoy shall look into this on all YTL Hotel. I can’t imagine to checked a guest take 10-15 minutes. With que of 5, I may need one hour. Why can’t there is early preparation?  A weak management on check in and reservation department.

21.review_text: Got a room for 1 night and luckily I came early for check in. The lines were long and maybe management can do something with the long waiting for check in. Got my room key and the room was what look like unfinish to me. There was oily stained in the fridge with a terrible smell. The toilet floor also look like half-heartly cleaned. Feel sticky on the floor when I step on it. The room was not properly cleaned as I found toothpick under table lamp. Seriously. There were no towels too so I call the room service and rectify these issue. They came and clean the fridge brought the towel. I also request for extra blanket from through the Marriott apps but none of my request being fulfilled. So I call the service once, twice and trice but nothing was sent. I did address this issue after…

22.review_text: We have always wanted to have our staycation here in Majestic KL but never have never done so. So, on our special day (ROM at 12.12), we have decided to checked in into this hotel to make our day extra special.  Even though we arrived at the hotel rather late at 7pm , our room wasn’t even ready yet (check in time supposedly to be 3pm). Front desk staff promised the room to be ready in 1.5 hours as the hotel was running at full capacity, shorthanded of housekeeping staff & coupled with their nice offer for late check out at 4pm.  After learning from other hotel guests (a group family) who has been waiting for more than 4 hours, we approached the front desk again & they needed another 1 hour (from initial 8.30pm delayed to 9pm). Therefore, we have decided to head out to grab some…

23.review_text: We stayed for a night and will unlikely return to stay at this hotel. Checking in was a nightmare. The receptionist was totally unhelpful when we wanted to book a slot for the pool. Said it was fully booked, but after we asked repeatedly for her to check, a slot at 8pm was suddenly available (means she didnt check when we initially asked?). We ordered food from Grab (bcs we had an inkling the dine in service would be poor judging from the check in service) but we requested for some plates and cutleries. The plates were only delivered after 2 HOURS and about 10 follow up calls, which was absolutely ridiculous that it took so long just to send up some empty plates! The pool was empty so not sure why the receptionist said it was fully booked, and there was no personnel there to…

24.review_text: Imagine 100 ppl lining up to check in at 3PM like in Pudu bus station. After standing in line for 30 mins, the front counter tells you the room is not ready, and when asked what time the room will be ready, all you get is "we will call you later, so sorry, just wait". Apparently they were going to make me wait 2 hours.   Secondly, booked a junior suite however at check-in was told the booking was for a standard room. After showing the reception that the price paid was indeed for a suite, all they could say was "take it up with your booking site".  Never returning to this crap hotel. How can a simple check-in process be so bad to actually make a guest leave? The worst thing is everyone working seems to find the entire situation acceptable.

25.review_text: The check in process took us from 230pm - 4pm and we had to wait until 8pm for our room to be ready. THAT IS A TOTAL OF 6 HOURS WAIT TO CHECK IN WHICH IS ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS BECAUSE WE HAVE A BABY WITH US AND THE RECEPTION MENTIONED THAT THEY WILL CALL US WHEN THE ROOM IS READY BUT WE DID NOT RECEIVE A SINGLE CALL. In the room, the wardrobe lights were not working, the pillows on the bed were not arranged nicely (it is as if housekeeping just throw it on the bed), the sinks were BOTH dirty with black water stains mark and the bathtub is also dirty. We called housekeeping and they arranged someone to come and clean the bathtub for us. And after that, we realized that the toilet seat was also dirty with dead insect bodies stuck onto the toilet seats. I would not imagine a hotel…

26.review_text: Booked package for junior suite, come with spa, wine, breakfast and late check out at 4pm @ myr 425++, really a good deal during pendamic time.  Arrival experience was averages, the receptionist seems new to me, like intern maybe, there was senior stand beside and guide her to do the job. Apparently, she did not explain in the details of my packages, just told me room is not ready at 1pm, no suggestions were given. Then, I asked if i can use the spa first, since i bought the deal, she was blur then went back to office to get help. After i got the key later at 3pm, no explaination on where to get the lift up to the room. I suggest training needed for Front Office staffs. I assumed the room will be spotless clean, since they insisted on check in time at 3pm, even tough i came on…

27.review_text: Booked high tea for two people in the drawing room. It is more expensive than the Colonial Cafe, but the ambience is so much worse. No background music, leftover crumbs on the floor, and no person greeting you at the entrance. You’ll have to wait a million years to try and get attention from the service stuff. I understand that budget cuts have been made across the hotel industry, but this was just an insult.   Honestly, I’ve received a lot better service in a mamak. A painfully overpriced lunch experience.

28.review_text: Recommend by one my friend to try the massage in At majestic , definitely won’t be regret to come over here , very classy environment and relaxing , moreover I definitely should mention the therapist were so professional and helpful and listen the my preferences, can’t wait to make the next reservation at the Spa again and Kudos to the Therapist Ishta ! Will be back again :)

29.review_text: We stayed in a junior suite which was on offer with some perks. Room is nice a plenty of space. The bathroom is mainly occupied by the bathtub in the middle which leaves little room for the rest, but if you like to take a bath with TV... Our major problem was the breakfast. Service was painfully slow an un attentive. Due to covid there was only a small counter with juice, fruit and pastries. Toast was on special demand (!!!) and didn't come with even the western plate. We didn't notice this juice counter and asked for a juice which was reluctantly brought to our table. The hotel cannot expect guests to return to this same restaurant for lunch or dinner after such a bad experience.

30.review_text: Check-in was okay, staff didn’t explain much about the facilities that can be used during CMCO and when I asked which eateries are opened, it was not answered, it left me a little clueless -which is quite surprising for a five-star hotel.   Upon check in, I was told that housekeeping service is only available upon request. Hence, I interpreted this as, unless I request for the service, otherwise, no one will come over to clean my room. However, I guess the housekeeping team is really eager to do their job 😂 despite mentioning many times that I do not need housekeeping service, they never failed to show up, ring my doorbell 4 mornings during my stay -which I take it as a miscommunication between front desk and housekeeping.   Colonial cafe’s food is not that great, while I…

31.review_text: Managed to experience this hotel on September after checking out from ritz carlton KL. A short staycation over the weekend.   I was greet by a friendly bellman and receptionist. My apologies I couldn’t remember the name. Room given was super spacious and clean except the bathroom where i found it wasn’t clean enough anyway I love the fancy bathtub with the tv tho!   I couldn’t resist The pool. It was amazing. Generally a lovely stay. Thanks to all staff for providing great customer experience. Well done!

32.review_text: Booked a room for a night stay for my mum. She loved it no issue at all . Room was perfect, quite spacious. I liked the dry bathroom: the bathtub with TV (even I didn't use it at that time). The pillows were too soft and not to my liking. I would definitely recommend you to come but maybe not for me. I have a trypophobia and the bathroom tiles all with a pattern of small holes. Almost all of the time I took my shower or doing "business", I didn't even want to look at the wall and it was stressing me. I was looking forward to have the buffet breakfast but unfortunately I was told by the front desk team that it only ala carte was available atm, which disappointed me.

33.review_text: I checked in on October 10th for one night. Very disappointed. There was no one to help me with my luggage to my room and I had to carry it up to my room myself. I ordered room service for dinner and was told to pay immediately, rather than sign for it. The room service menu was very limited. Only 7 items. There was no room service at all for breakfast. Certainly, not 5 Star service. More like a budget hotel.

34.review_text: I accompanied my friend to.Kuala Lumpur and we stayed at the majestic Kuala Lumpur and this hotel is by glory is exactly like it's name - majestic! It is very well proportion and the service is well very very very very good.

35.review_text: My partner and I checked into Majestic Kl on a Friday as they had a stay and dine promotion.  Room was good, service was good. And the room came with a buffet dinner for two at contango followed by buffet breakfast in the morning.  Definitely worth it for a night stay :)
